    Just as the bee, catching the first glimpse of the beauty of an asana, is suddenly driven to sip its honey.

    Canto 53

    I.

    After he had deflowered her, that most excellent of maidens was exhausted and weak.

    The prince, desire unabated, cradled her, his heart full* of deep yearning.

    The beautiful girl was the embodiment of the splendour of a wilted lotus,

    But because she was so painfully affected as she sank down, he whispered sweet words to her.

    II.

    The prince was even more disturbed by the princess,

    As in the light of the lamps,* she seemed even more wan and pale.

    Now, so exhausted was she that she lay there as still as a statue of gold,

    As the prince gently embraced her, cradling her on his lap and rearranging her robe.

    III.

    But the woebegone princess dejectedly slipped away from him.

    She was aghast at the blood glistening on her dress.

    So her adoring lover, not wanting to leave her side, carried her out

    To the outer verandah, going to find attendants to bathe her.

    IV.

    Her maids were waiting, close at hand, with everything all prepared

    And laid out in position for bathing her. All were skilled in understanding subtleties and giving guidance,

    All versed in soothing and bestowing great care on her.

    We will not tell of the goddess as she was bathed there beside her lover.

    V.

    After they had both been bathed, the girl who had now just experienced the intimacy of marriage,

    Was petted and watched over* by her loving maid:

    ‘Dear lady, resign yourself to bear a little pain,

    For your sorrow will soon turn to desire, my dear.

    VI.

    ‘The flowers of the fragrant lotus, jasmine and nāgapuṣpa

    Are nothing less than a sign* that it is appropriate

    For passionate bees to buzz around* them and ravish them.

    No mistress, I believe that being married is similar.

    VII.

    ‘Little one, you should return quickly to the pavilion. Oh, do go back my dear.

    The one who yearns for you is held in thrall, and eagerly awaits you.’

    And she urged her so insistently that the princess was ashamed

    And mounted slowly back into the fragrant bridal chamber.

    VIII.

    On her return, the princess huddled in the farthest corner of the beautiful chamber.

    The prince, with mounting joy, took her onto his lap,

    Caressing her and looking closely at her pale, drawn face,

    Then kissed her passionately, his sweet words falling like rain drops:

    Canto 54

    I.

    ‘You are the very relative of the moon, you are the rumbling of the thunder of desire, the gentle rain of the raptures of love.

    You bring me constant heartache, so that I burgeon with passion, and my love puts forth new shoots.

    Moreover,* as I embrace your charms, suddenly offering me flowers of desire,*

    My joy knows no limit in being intertwined with you in the reality of sexual union.

    II.

    ‘Now see, beloved, how fortunate I am to be your partner and share love with you.

    You, my lady, signify the end of my earthly existence. You are the provisions I will carry to the next world as I lie next to you in repose.

    Indeed, in the hidden depths of your eyes, transfixed, I let myself be carried away on the tide of my yearning,

    And I, your humble slave, will die willing, by casting myself* into the sea of honey to be as one with your sweetness.’

    Canto 55

    I.

    In this way, he calmed the princess as he sought to comfort her.

    Enchantingly, he cradled her head in his lap, giving her delicious betel-leaf, eagerly kissing her lips,

    Brushing back her hair, skillfully bestowing great care on her,

    Holding her hand, never wearying of resting his eyes on the fullness of her breasts.

    II.

    All the while, softly, tremulously, he murmured love poems, wave upon wave of sweet sentiments,

    Alternating with the pleasure of passionately kissing her beautiful cheek.

    With the sweetest expressions of love, he began all over again* to address her fondly,

    Disturbing the newly blossoming areca flower, filling her with the constant sound.

    III.

    The union of the prince and most excellent princess, there on the bridal couch,

    Could be likened to that of the mangunəng and jasmine or the katirah touching the wəlas-harəp creeper,

    As beautiful as the charming gaḍung entwining and merging with the wanañjari.*

    Such was their union, as they shared together in the raptures of love.

    IV.

    The delighted prince abandoned himself to the pursuit of erotic pleasure, there on the couch,

    All night long, unable to sleep, so often did he caress the princess.

    His words of love could be heard by the women hidden behind the curtains spying on them, and their sighs,

    And the constant tinkling of their anklets, told of their penetration into the secrets of sexual intercourse.

    Canto 56

    I.

    The night passed and as day came, the bright light of the sun shone down.

    When it was time for the kraban ceremonies and everything was ready,

    Everything was so wondrous and incomparable that it seemed to have come from Indra’s heaven,

    For it was King Harimūrti who had ordered them to be prepared and had seen to their arrangement.

    II.

    The exquisite seven fragrances,* deer-navel musk and sandalwood spread over all,

    Bringing enchantment to the girl who had for the first time known a man there on the couch.

    Incense glowed, its vapour seemed to waft* there to enhance the delight,

    Seeking out the radiance of the cawəli silk of the curtains, always so fragrant.

    III.

    The delightful melodies of kidung, accompanied on the lute, began to play,

    Sounding so much like bees that everyone thought it was spring.

    Then as these constant offerings seemed to increase in splendour, their thoughts turned again to love,

    An experience so wondrous that it laid to rest her fear of love-making.

    IV.

    In full view, the two went out and sat side-by-side on the verandah.

    After they had bathed and put on their jewels and ornaments,

    They looked as sweet as the conjoined beauty of the lotus and honey,

    Bearing with fortitude* the presence of the maids, all of whom were beautiful and were wearing many maṇḍaga* ornaments.

    V.

    Finally a gentle elderly lady* from the palace charged with* their care,

    Who was learned* in interpreting auspicious signs, summoned them to come forth.

    And so the two then stood up and came out to the audience hall,

    Where the Yadu tribe was being sumptuously entertained as they feasted outside.

    VI.

    To tell of all that took place would take too long. As day departed,

    The bridal pair moved away together to the beautiful pavilion where they would spend the night.

    People thought of them as the beautiful asana flower and the bee,

    As the two lovers devoted themselves to each other with caresses, shared comforts and sweet whisperings.

    VII.

    The princess’s apprehension then ceased as her love unfolded

    Because the sweet prince completely won over her downcast heart.

    Like the deep joy of ivory bamboo when it comes into contact with the rain from the clouds,

    Desire pierced her, filling her to the core, as she became one with the prince.

    VIII.

    It was the same for the prince, as he sought release from passion in their sexual union,

    A devotee of loving, that reached perfection there on the couch.

    His languid sidelong glance was the box of sacrifical unguent he placed on her firm breasts*

    And his caresses were the acts of worship arising from his invocation of the presence of the god in their sexual union.*

    IX.

    Later, they ate the delicious food that lay ready.

    The food, drink and delicacies were quite perfect.

    Any wonderful gift, anything at all that they desired, was there

    Because of Kr̥ṣṇa, the paramount, heroic king, who was the embodiment on earth of the incarnation of the eight kingly virtues.

    Canto 57

    I.

    And so it was that their union was a thing of joy.

    Never wearying of each other, one in spirit were they in the interchange of love and passion.

    Many months went by. Their every action was in harmony,

    Their happiness grew with the burgeoning of their great love.

    II.

    We will pass over the description of their marriage.

    The twelfth year of exile came and went.

    Phalguṇa’s mind then turned to thoughts

    Of those he had left behind.* How could he now abandon them?

    III.

    It is in the nature of existence that the pain of separation cannot prevail.*

    Great longing then subtly takes up residence in the heart

    So that sorrow and loss of peace of mind take possession of it,

    And it may happen that one forgets the gifts of the wheel of existence.

    IV.

    And so Pārtha’s mind was troubled

    And he said to his bride:

    ‘My darling wife, my little sister, you are indeed my very being.

    O my lady, you purge my longing and put an end to my sorrow.

    V.

    ‘But now increasingly my own desires defer to

    My great devotion to my beloved mother* and brothers.

    Because for so long now I have left them abandoned,

    I think only of what has become of them in the palace there.

    VI.

    ‘But my devotion to you, my dear is ever constant.

    I wish to share your love. Come with me to my own home,

    And stay with me there in Indraprastha. My dear, have no fear.

    Our hearts will find perfect peace in living in accordance with what is right, my darling.

    VII.

    ‘So here is the course we must take, my beloved.

    It is my duty to pay homage in the dust at the feet of the King

    And your place is to be beside me as my faithful and beloved wife.

    And thus you too may properly carry out the wishes of Yudhisthira, the son of Dharma.’

    VIII.

    Thus said the prince, lovingly addressing her with kind and gentle words.

    So the princess gave him answer, her voice faltering:

    ‘O my Lord, I know what you say is virtuous and right.

    How could I not follow the proper duty of a wife?

    IX.

    ‘It is only that I am bewildered, torn in two by how I will suffer and yearn

    Greatly for my own mother and my lord the king,

    Not forgetting my brothers, who call to me with longing, holding me back.

    I cannot repay their love by bringing them grief.

    X.

    ‘My devotion to my parents is beyond words

    Truly it as great as both the mountains, Hima and Sumeru.

    But if I told of my love for you,

    It would truly be wider than the widest ocean.’

    XI.

    We will say no more of their conversation

    After they had agreed to the prince’s resolution.

    That night they slept in mutual delight in the fragrant bed,

    Their hearts absorbed in joining together in desire, swept away by passion.

    Canto 58

    I.

    The next morning, the prince and his beloved awoke and came out from the bower.

    They went to the water-spouts where they bathed joyfully together.

    When they left the water, they gently stroked each other’s faces, blowing into each other’s eyes,*

    Arranging flowers here and there,* he decorated the princess’s fragrant hair-knot.

    II.

    After adorning themselves fittingly, they came forth hand-in-hand, strolling away together.

    It seemed that Manmatha, the god of the love-couch, was present in his eyes and in his sweet teeth.

    There, on the tiled verandah, they sat together with thighs touching,

    And any who saw the princess sitting on his lap, exchanging chewed betel, thought they were the God and Goddess of Love.

    III.

    ‘If I were to die, how delightful it would be if I could return as a bee.

    I could passionately enjoy your charms for ever, if they were in the fragrant asana flowers in the garden.

    I would know ecstasy even if the gaḍing repulsed and wounded me or I were struck down by a rain of honey.

    If I died, but bore the signs of my joy at making love to you, I would have reached heaven.’*

    IV.

    This was the way Pārtha spoke, his words as sweet as the incarnation of syrup.

    Delighted and full of ardent longing, he entwined the fingers of her hand, then reached out* to encircle her waist.

    Like the jangga embracing the slender young shoots of the ivory coconut, he softly directed himself to her ear,

    But the goddess turned away sighing again, languishing as the prince caressed her.

    V.

    We will not tell of their love. Finally they came forth, making their way to the inner court.

    There the prince and the most excellent princess entered the presence of king Basudewa who was there with Halāyudha

    And Lord Kr̥ṣṇa. The lovers both came there,

    And bowed reverently at the king’s feet. He at once received Dhanañjaya benevolently.

    VI.

    The prince paid obeisance: ‘I beg you, O King, to hear my request.

    I seek leave to return to my home and therefore, I, your humble servant,* kiss your feet.

    Please do not think that I am ungrateful or indifferent, or that I wish to cast aside your favour

    Or seem to neglect my duty, for indeed, those who would be freed from their bonds face great difficulties.’

    VII.

    After Dhanañjaya had begged leave, the king embraced him:

    ‘Oh my son, I understand, my boy, that your heart is firm in our cause.

    But if you must go, then I shall divide my kingdom, lands and possessions,

    And all the most excellent things that befit a king throughout our kingdom you will enjoy, now you are close-bound* to us.

    VIII.

    ‘Indeed always be generous, my son, when you see the worthlessness of those who have no protection, show them compassion.

    May you never encounter difficulty, or be neglectful of the teachings, cruel in your affections, or harsh.

    My daughter, apply yourself well, for clearly it is your duty to serve your lord and show him every care,

    And thus you will come to know the love of Kuntī, your Lady Aunt* and elder brothers if you always bear in mind the duties of a younger person.’

    IX.

    Thus was his advice, and the prince, who thought it was like the water of life, then bowed* in reverent acknowledgement.

    Lord Kr̥ṣṇa declared that he would accompany them home, because he loved them so.

    Nor did Baladewa wish to be left behind, he too wanted to go with the prince

    But resolutely the prince denied them, saying that in the future they would certainly visit.

    Canto 59

    I.

    We will not tell of their deliberation.

    Away sped a messenger carrying the king’s words

    To Yudhiṣṭhira and his consort,

    Making his way to the kingdom of Indraprastha.

    II.

    We will not tell of the departure of the royal messenger

    But again tell of Pārtha.

    From the court he returned to his quarters,

    Where many members of the Wr̥ṣṇi family visited him with offers of assistance.

    III.

    Their offerings as they came to pay homage were delightful.

    All were weeping, so filled were they with love,

    Their affectionate natures dominating them and overwhelming them

    With constant thoughts of love for the princess.

    IV.

    And as for the princess, she too was moved to tears

    And wept bitterly, her heart moved by compassion,

    Disheartened and saddened now that separation was imminent,

    Not knowing what to think, suddenly beginning to lament.

    Canto 60

    I.

    The ladies of the court who together were charged with the regulation of affairs* in the inner chamber,

    Were frantically busy, for suddenly, not only did they have to make preparations but also apply themselves to embroidery.*

    But we will not describe those who were to accompany them to Indraprastha, all were impatient to go.

    All through the night came a quiet hum as they threaded strings of ornaments very carefully.*

    Canto 61

    I.

    We will not tell of this. The next morning, at the appointed time, when the countryside was fresh,

    Pārtha bid farewell and set off with his beloved.

    Together, all watched them climb into their seats in their chariot,

    As with Dāruki, their charioteer, at the ready, they left in magnificent and splendid style.

    II.

    The Wr̥ṣṇi troops, who would be the guard on their journey, were prepared and at the ready.

    Immediately they too set off from the palace, in a procession of chariots,

    Leaving those left behind so despondent that they could only stare anxiously after them,

    Lost in thought and grieving, as if they longed to set off after them and go too.

    III.

    Great indeed was their yearning. But we will tell now of the son of Pāṇḍu.

    On and on he journeyed, past settlements they took their course.

    The countryside through which they passed was beautiful, and again and again he stopped along the way so that they might disport,

    Thinking up all kinds of excuses* to comfort his beloved’s heartache.

    IV.

    They came upon many different villages, and all were expecting them,

    Ready to offer tribute, for indeed the prince was truly a man of distinction endowed with every good quality.

    Thus, there was no hesitation at all because he repaid them joyfully with royal grants,

    And all surrendered their hearts in homage and respect to him.

    V.

    It would take too long to tell of the time they spent on the road, stopping overnight here and there.

    They came to Indraprastha where they were welcomed by the whole court,

    Chief amongst them Kuntī and the sons of Pāṇḍu, with Yudhisthira in first place.

    ‘It is like a ray of light in the darkness’, thought the people throughout the land.

    VI.

    Without further ado, Lady Kuntī delightedly embraced Pārtha’s bride.

    Because she had looked forward so eagerly to their arrival,

    All she could say was: ‘My dear daughter! My son!’ so moved that her tears began to flow

    And deluged the hair-knots of the two who paid her homage there before her.

    VII.

    As for Dharmatanaya, he too was full of joy,

    As were Bhīma, the heroic Nakula and his brother, all were also overjoyed

    To see Pārtha, returning as a world conqueror to his family,

    Moreover, he had won the world-renowned goddess of the Yadu tribe.

    VIII.

    It would take so long to describe the happiness of the king and all the court.

    The five sons of Pāṇḍu returned together to the palace,

    Accompanied by Kuntī. Ever at the side of Subhadrā, Pārtha’s wife,

    Was the Lady Dropadī, who looked to her needs and was full of affection for her.

    IX.

    The homage that had been prepared for them was extraordinary.

    They were received with prayers of good fortune by the court priests and the foremost among learned religious leaders.

    The feasting and ceremonies were perfect,

    And all the ladies of noble birth, overcome with love, were happy to serve them.

    X.

    And thus Phalguṇa returned, his fame yet more renowned.

    Ever more safe and sound was that most excellent kingdom, now restored to prosperity, knowing no impediment.

    The members of each caste and stage of life,* as well as all the common people knew good fortune once again, as they had before.

    Yudhistira, son of Dharma, in his most wondrous and excellent majesty, was the parasol protecting the whole world.

    Canto 62

    I.

    He* was as perfect as god Indra. How could his power, that so abounded in goodness, be surpassed?

    Shamed, the evil-doers stopped. They were destroyed and good men prospered.

    The admonitions of the great seer were undiminished, for he had instructed them in the proper course for those cursed to rely on the senses.*

    In short, the four brothers were the source of his strength, while the sage kept watch over the eldest among them always.

    II.

    Blameless was he, occupying himself constantly with his subjects, fostering dharma like a light in the darkness of the land.

    Renowned throughout the world for his great courage, his might ever the strong protection of the world.

    As long as the kṣatriya warriors lived in righteousness, no evil could befall those who led the hermit’s life.

    In prosperity, he was the place of refuge for the helpless, caring for them, succouring them.

    III.

    And so, now here ends the story in praise of him who is the caretaker of the world.

    It is called The Journeying of Pārtha, the work of one who humbly seeks help and audaciously presumes to imitate [great poets].

    Deficient though it is, may it be received by the most excellent of men, may he not take offence at it, even though it is without merit.

    May His Majesty, Surawīrya, have compassion and give his blessing to my efforts to capture beauty in verse.

    Bibliography

    Edited and translated by Creese (1998). Digital data furnished by the author processed tgo XML-TEI by Axelle Janiak and Arlo Griffiths (2025).

    References

    Creese, Helen. 1998. Pārthāyaṇa, The journeying of Pārtha: An eighteenth-century Balinese kakawin. Bibliotheca Indonesica, 27. Leiden: KITLV Press.

    35 <listWit>
    . <!--
    .K = lontar ms from Puri Kawan, Singaraja (HKS 2715 = HKS 5202)
    .L = HKS 3995
    .J = common reading of KL
    40R = HKS Bundle 9, no 7 = LOr.13.324
    .S = HKS 2694
    .Q = common reading of RS
    .MSS = reading of all manuscripts
    .* = word or phrase is discussed in the Notes.
    45†...† = blurred sections of MS K
    . -->

    65 <encodingDesc>
    . <projectDesc>
    . <p>Encoded in TEI according to the <ref target="{URI for DHARMA editorial conventions or page with link to Encoding Guides}">Conventions of ERC-Project DHARMA</ref>.</p>
    . <!-- A second paragraph can be used to acknowledge any relevant funding agency, project acronym and number, any to specify for instance that the edition results from a personal research project such as a PhD.
    . -->
    70 </projectDesc>
    . <editorialDecl>
    . <p>The following normalizations to Helen Creese’s source text have been implemented:</p>
    . <list>
    . <item>Capitalizations of proper names have been downcased.</item>
    75 <item>Spaces before (n)ira, (n)iṅ, and n have been removed.</item>
    . <item>The transliteration has been normalized:
    . <list>
    . <item>rṇn to rṇ</item>
    . <item>ê to e</item>
    80 <item>â to ā</item>
    . <item>î to ī</item>
    . <item>ĕ to ə</item>
    . <item>ö to ə̄</item>
    . <item>ṛ to r̥</item>
    85 <item>ng to ṅ</item>
    . <item>w to v</item>
    . </list>
    . </item>
    . </list>
    90 <p>The following still have to be dealt with:</p>
    . <list>
    . <item>square brackets [...] in edition</item>
    . <item>use of italics in edition: metri causa departures from spelling of K (as explained by Creese, p. 11) — to be encoded as ḍīpa in 53.2</item>
    . <item>presence of <hi rend="superscript">†</hi>
    95 </item>
    . </list>
    . <correction>
    . <p/>
    . </correction>
    100 <normalization>
    . <p/>
    . </normalization>
    . <interpretation>
    . <p/>
    105 </interpretation>
    . </editorialDecl>
    . <samplingDecl>
    . <p/>
    . </samplingDecl>
    110 </encodingDesc>
    . <revisionDesc>
    . <change who="part:anol" when="2025-06-20" status="draft">normalization</change>

    . <change who="part:axja" when="2025-05-25" status="draft">conversion to TEI-XML from word files</change>
    115 </revisionDesc>
    . </teiHeader>
    . <text xml:space="preserve">
    . <body>
    . <div type="edition" xml:lang="kaw-Latn">
    120<div><ab type="invocation">avighnam astu</ab></div>
    .<div type="canto" rend="met" n="1" met="jagaddhita">
    .<lg n="1">
    .<l n="a">tustusniṅ kalaṅə̄n anindya paramārtha pinahuvus i tatvaniṅ kavi</l>
    .<l n="b">dhyāyī sātmya ri ləṅləṅiṅ kamala hadvaya pinatəh i sāndhiniṅ hiḍəp</l>
    125<l n="c">nyāsan riṅ kakavin tinap pinakasāntən i juraṅiṅ acaṇḍya luṅ laṅə̄</l>
    .<l n="d">maṅgəh litniṅ adr̥śyatantra madanodaya vəkasiṅ acintya niṣkala</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="2">
    .<l n="a">āpan yan vinidāna kastavan irān paṅavaki rəcəpiṅ pasir vukir</l>
    130<l n="b">byaktāmiśra luput ndatan pahaməṅan mamiṣayani raras haneṅ kapə̄</l>
    .<l n="c">tāvat yan guruniṅ tanah tutugiṅ ākṣara pinakahirəṅ haneṅ karas</l>
    .<l n="d">nāhan prastutiniṅ maṅarccana rarab ni sukunira vinimba nityasa</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="3">
    135<l n="a">maṅke ṅvaṅ ləṅəṅ aṅdadak tumura varṇana palupuy anātpadeṅ laṅə̄</l>
    .<l n="b">ndan dūran katəkāna kevala mahāṅrivəgi kapana rakva yan siṅi</l>
    .<l n="c">hāmhām de ni kətər nikaṅ jalada tibra kagagat aṅalap karas tanah</l>
    .<l n="d">tan tuṅkul ri kapiṅgiṅiṅ hati cuməṅga raga-ragan aṅiṣṭi kośala</l>
    .</lg>
    140 <!-- 3 (a) Q avarṇa, S palupuya -->
    .<lg n="4">
    .<l n="a">yan kāṅən halaniṅ tuvuh viphala nistura gati nika tan paṅenaka</l>
    .<l n="b">vetniṅ duṣkr̥ta lot mahambalan ibək prihati viraha śoka lampunən</l>
    .<l n="c">ləṅləṅ bhranta pinə̄m halib taya ta sāmbatən amanəhi tan sihiṅ vidhi</l>
    145<l n="d">maṅgā mūra matiṅgaleṅ śana vanāśrama ya juga parāna menaka</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="5">
    .<l n="a">donyan māntəna kaśmalanya hana darśśana ta sira saṅ āryya phalguṇa</l>
    .<l n="b">śrī drupadātmajāpupul i dharmmatanaya dinunuṅ nire daləm</l>
    150<l n="c">yāṅde trāsa manah dhanañjaya maṅiṣṭya layat avanavāśa tan vaneh</l>
    .<l n="d">ṅkān māmvīt ta sire narendra pakamaṅgala kaməna nirān humaṅkata</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="6">
    .<l n="a">eñjiṅ vāhu lumə̄ṅ bhaṭāra ravi muṅgu riṅ udaya madan nr̥pātmaja</l>
    155<l n="b">sāmpun məntas aṅarccana krama mijil ta sira saka rikaṅ purāṅənəs</l>
    .<l n="c">tar sah taṅ varayaṅ laras kavaca yeka ta vinavanira ṅ varāyudha</l>
    .<l n="d">jāti kṣatriyadharmma maṅkana purih saṅ ataki-taki vīryya riṅ prajā</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 6 (a) S asvi for ravi (c) Q tan -->
    160<lg n="7">
    .<l n="a">ndah śīghrān ləpasiṅ svarājya laku saṅ nr̥patanaya sinaṅgraheṅ laṅə̄</l>
    .<l n="b">akveh sobha taman-taman katəmu denira ri vəlahaniṅ purāśrama</l>
    .<l n="c">kayvanyān pakəmul-kəmul hima savaṅ lumuh alara mame kakiṅkiṅan</l>
    .<l n="d">humbutniṅ liraṅ ārjja rumbay aməḍar savaṅ aṅəsah akuṅ hameri luh</l>
    165</lg>
    . <!-- 7 (c) L pakəmu-kəmul (d) L rumambay; -->
    .<lg n="8">
    .<l n="a">luṅhā lampah i saṅ narendrasuta maṅkin umalivat adoh sakeṅ sabhā</l>
    .<l n="b">oruk tiṅkah ikaṅ kināryyakən avarṇa salahasa yadin katoliha</l>
    170<l n="c">tistis lvīr akəkəs-kəkəs kalamukan havuk amuni laṅə̄nya suṅkava</l>
    .<l n="d">krāmniṅ vai manisih ya tābalut apiṇḍa pamataniṅ unəṅ linurvakən</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 8 (c) L alamukan avuk -->
    .<lg n="9">
    175<l n="a">təkvan rāmya nikaṅ basantamasa rāmya ri havanira rāmya tūt hənu</l>
    .<l n="b">kāryy ānvam haṅəlih-ṅəlih səmi nikaṅ kayu kasirir avarṇa koyaṅan</l>
    .<l n="c">polahnyān aṅəsah savaṅ paṅəsahiṅ ruḍita viphala kuṅnya de nira</l>
    .<l n="d">avrā kīrṇa tibeṅ ləmah paḍa luñut kusuma nika katon sumamburat</l>
    .</lg>
    180 <!-- 9 (b) Q aṅəlih-əlih -->
    .<lg n="10">
    .<l n="a">nyagrodhānvam aneka boddhi nika yan paruruhurana len prih ambulu</l>
    .<l n="b">lumrā ṅ pakṣy anacar paḍāsira-siran təka sumayab alivraniṅ tahən</l>
    .<l n="c">məṅgəp syuṅnya na medi-medi sinameni bayan ika marək sagocara</l>
    185<l n="d">ahrit śabda nikaṅ kuvoṅ siniriṅiṅ valik alara tinambaṅiṅ cucur</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="11">
    .<l n="a">prāpteṅ pora ḍusun-ḍusun hana təgal-təgal i hiriṅaniṅ gunuṅ-gunuṅ</l>
    .<l n="b">vvaṅ māhvan ya paḍāṅariṅ ndan aləbā patarukan i gagānya tūt gəgər</l>
    190<l n="c">dudv āmə̄h susu kapva maṅkana lanā gavayan ika marək mareṅ pura</l>
    .<l n="d">rīndrapraṣṭha nahan prasiddha pahulanya suruhan i gavenya nityasa</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 11 (c) R gave nikan umarək, S gava nikan umarək -->
    .<lg n="12">
    195<l n="a">məṇḍuṅ vāhu sumār javuhnya maniram-nirami tarukaniṅ lurah-lurah</l>
    .<l n="b">maṅkin kentar ado[h] himanya təkapiṅ pavana mahəli tejaniṅ ravi</l>
    .<l n="c">bhrantā ṅ cātaka maṅlaṅūt ri surudiṅ jalada malih i rāmyaniṅ vukir</l>
    .<l n="d">hetunyan paṅamarmmakən ri sira kelu salahasa tumiṅhali ṅ tavaṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    200 <!-- 12 (b) L ketar; = Q -->
    .<lg n="13">
    .<l n="a">tan magyā ta laris nirān krama halintaṅ i tatarabaniṅ vanāntara</l>
    .<l n="b">kveh katyāgan aneka taṅ kabuyutan tinəmunira katon paḍāhaləp</l>
    .<l n="c">lāvan maṇḍala dharmmaśāla kuṭi pājaran arəja vihāra sə̄h laṅə̄</l>
    205<l n="d">liṅsirniṅ savitā pireka lavasiṅ divasa təka sireṅ sarasvatī</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 13 (a) S alari -->
    .<lg n="14">
    .<l n="a">siṅgih nirmmala bañv inuttama pavitra pinakabañuniṅ vanāśrama</l>
    210<l n="b">tovin śuddha hi maikalanyan apasir-pasir analaga mādrakāḍake</l>
    .<l n="c">rañjiṅ-rañjiṅ ikālaṅə̄ panilukanyan asaji-saji pūrṇa paṅkaja</l>
    .<l n="d">paṅliṅgan ri daləmnya tan patatalan marahakəna gatinyan uttama</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 14 (b) Q śuddha i; L makalanya -->
    215<lg n="15">
    .<l n="a">āmbək saṅ nr̥paputra harṣaja tumiṅhali kaləṅəṅaniṅ mahānadī</l>
    .<l n="b">mambə̄ rāmya ni posikiṅ jaladhi posik i bañu nika mosik ombakan</l>
    .<l n="c">mātrānūb lariniṅ samīraṇa mataṅnya kumucak amaṅun larap-larap</l>
    .<l n="d">ryyak-ryyaknyān lalitāmijah lvir agiraṅ ta mamapag i saṅ āryya phalguṇa</l>
    220</lg>
    . <!-- 15 (b) Q kombakan -->
    .<lg n="16">
    .<l n="a">haṅsa śveta ya tānəlat ri təṅahiṅ sarayi mahas avarṇa maṅləṅəṅ</l>
    .<l n="b">kahyun-hyun tumiliṅ-tiliṅ ri kətəriṅ bhramara vijah amanva-manvakən</l>
    225<l n="c">lvir mājar həniṅiṅ nadī tikin inulvalaniṅ anila medy ariṅgəkan</l>
    .<l n="d">denyāsnāna nirāgraheṅ vipula paṅkaja kahanan ikāpuḍe-puḍe</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 16 (a) S sarayu (b) L māhamban hyun for kahyun-hyun -->
    .<lg n="17">
    230<l n="a">ṅkāne lvāni pasir-pasirnya tamatan dahat adaləm aṅāmbək-āmbəki</l>
    .<l n="b">honyekaṅ kaga cakravāka kalavan priya maṅalihi menduṅ-enduṅan</l>
    .<l n="c">muṅgvīṅ paṅkaja lot yathāsuka mapahyunan amiruru bajra keśara</l>
    .<l n="d">keṅəl pva ṅ haravinda marmmara kacūrṇan i pakəpək ikaṅ vihaṅgama</l>
    .</lg>
    235<lg n="18">
    .<l n="a">aśrī reh ni hiriṅ-hiriṅnyan ahijo paḍa marəja baṅun linaṅvakən</l>
    .<l n="b">deniṅ śevala məṅgəp aṅragəti pantəs aniru-niru gātraniṅ pupur</l>
    .<l n="c">nāntən teki savaṅ paras-paras ikaṅ vvaṅ ahayu sahajāmaṅun raras</l>
    .<l n="d">lvir saptaṅkura sumrak aṅlələh i denyan avaṅi pakis əṇḍahiṅ bañu</l>
    240</lg>
    . <!-- 18 (b) S doniṅ -->
    .<lg n="19">
    .<l n="a">vvantən satpada medran aṅrarah amūrvva raras i ləṅəṅiṅ saroruha</l>
    .<l n="b">darpanyālivəran ya monəṅ akaraṅ-karaṅ aṅarəki kosapeṅ hr̥buk</l>
    245<l n="c">hūmrəṅ lvir kətəriṅ kapat tuvin arūm lalita jaya-jayanya komala</l>
    .<l n="d">lvir hūṅkāra pamūrṣitanya ri narendratanaya ruməsəp nirāntara</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="20">
    .<l n="a">ṅkā rakvān tuməḍun sirārahup acāmana luməkas asūryyasaivana</l>
    250<l n="b">māryy āṅel sira denya maṅkin alilaṅ tvasira təlas irān paṅarccana</l>
    .<l n="c">ndah məntas tumuluy sakeṅ bañu tathāpi kajənəkana riṅ śilātala</l>
    .<l n="d">harṣānon ri pakuṅnya yāviṅ-aviṅan vatu haṅiṅin-iṅin muṅup-muṅup</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 20 (c) S tumuluya -->
    255<lg n="21">
    .<l n="a">len taṅ harṣa nirān mulat ri gatiniṅ piṅul amijah i lo nikaṅ bañu</l>
    .<l n="b">təkvan medi ləkas nikin paṅicipir hana gumivaṅ anambi riṅ vatu</l>
    .<l n="c">yekāṅde kusutiṅ nadī jaga-jaga ṅ kuluma milu kavəs marambəhan</l>
    .<l n="d">ṅkān kāgyat təkapiṅ vihaṅga kumucup karaṇa nika larup* mareṅ rəṇək</l>
    260</lg>
    . <!-- 21 (d) Q larut -->
    .<lg n="22">
    .<l n="a">maṅkin konaṅ-unaṅ tikaṅ valahar aṅləṅəṅi kadi hamiṇḍa riṅ tavaṅ</l>
    .<l n="b">siṅhit pva ṅ ravi rukṣa taṅ kusuma honya ta kasavur i pombakiṅ bañu</l>
    265<l n="c">lvir vintaṅ dinələ̄ haləpnya sumarambah anama-nama raśminiṅ suji</l>
    .<l n="d">lvir puṣpāñjali śuddha tulya pasayutnya yan aṅucapa rakva liṅ nira</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 22 (c) S anamar-namar -->
    .<lg n="23">
    270<l n="a">nyāśokāsana puṣpa bāṇa paḍa lurva kakiraṇan i tīraniṅ nadī</l>
    .<l n="b">kapvāśā magəyuh laṅə̄nya katavan smi ta kusuma nikaṅ tahən madhu</l>
    .<l n="c">tan samvas makire manis mala-malar susupana riṅ akuṅ macaṅkrama</l>
    .<l n="d">rāmyānūt ri patiṅgaliṅ bhramara māri maṅarəki hinernya yan rurū</l>
    .</lg>
    275 <!-- 23 (d) LS maṅrəki -->
    .<lg n="24">
    .<l n="a">rūmnya ṅganya parantyaniṅ rimaṅ aṅarccana madanavilāśa riṅ jinəm</l>
    .<l n="b">honya ṅ tañjuṅ aṅambvakən kusuma mār mrat aṅavadi sugandha kāṅinan</l>
    .<l n="c">mambv ārūm panəḍəṅ nikaṅ śikari mogha tan akalib aliṇḍuṅan vuṅū</l>
    280<l n="d">tapvan marmma hure ni sāntən ika molur acavit ajageṅ smarātura</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 24 (a) Q parantiniṅ -->
    .<lg n="25">
    .<l n="a">kālanyan ri tiliṅ hyaṅ ārkka makucəm kaləṅəṅan ika suksəkālaṅə̄</l>
    285<l n="b">heman tan hananiṅ mahas-mahas acaṅkrama maṅucapa rūmnya riṅ karas</l>
    .<l n="c">sis denyan vvaya taṅ mayūra sahajāṅariṅ-ariṅ anamar mahas maṅə̄</l>
    .<l n="d">pantəs yan kəkəsənya riṅ rasa vilāpa kaləṅəṅan ikaṅ sarasvati</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 25 (b) Q mahas-ahas; Q ramya for rūmnya (c) R inserts (amahas) before mahas -->
    290<lg n="26">
    .<l n="a">maṅgəh buddhi nirān maṅə̄ miṅət-iṅət [r]yy amənanira nahan rinūpaka</l>
    .<l n="b">siddhāniṅ lumicin maṅiṣṭya pavəkas parama r̥ṣi rikāna lakṣyakən</l>
    .<l n="c">vetniṅ lvā nikanaṅ daśendriya ruməñcəm amaribhava litnya riṅ tutur</l>
    .<l n="d">yekāṅde hilaṅiṅ Śivasmr̥ti ləbur bisama madəg ikaṅ rajah tamah</l>
    295</lg>
    . <!-- 26 (a) = Q (c) Q mamaribhava -->
    .<lg n="27">
    .<l n="a">āṅhiṅ kottamaniṅ hiḍəp taki-takin riṅ anəmu-nəmu tatvaniṅ hurip</l>
    .<l n="b">byaktāvās kadi cakraniṅ ratha yadin hulurana ləvu denya tan padon</l>
    300<l n="c">āpañ jāti nikaṅ śarīra taya leñ juga dadahakəniṅ yaśādhikā</l>
    .<l n="d">yekīn kenakaniṅ tuvuh niyata hayva maləməha riṅ viṣṭiniṅ hayu</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 27 (b) L huluranā -->
    .<lg n="28">
    305<l n="a">nāhan vastu ni de nirāṅaṅən-aṅən tulusa ni paṅadeśa saṅ r̥ṣi</l>
    .<l n="b">lvir bhrantākuyəṅañ juga* ṅ hati dhumāraṇa kapatəhaniṅ daśendriya.</l>
    .<l n="c">āpan bheda nikaṅ hiḍəp ya ta maveh sukər aləməh i sandhiniṅ smr̥ti</l>
    .<l n="d">hetunyan humənəṅ samāntaji vinodanan i kətər i śabdaniṅ kuvoṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    310 <!-- 28 (a) R paṅdesa, S paṅudesa (b) = LQ, K jaga -->
    .</div>
    .<div type="canto" rend="met" n="2" met="navaharṣa">
    .<lg n="1">
    .<l n="a">irikā ta muvah lumaku sira ri liṅsir ikaṅ divasa</l>
    315<l n="b">paraniṅ tvas iniṣṭinira taya vaneh ṅhiṅ ikaṅ himavān</l>
    .<l n="c">ndah amūrvva ta lampahira taman aṅel mahavan palapat</l>
    .<l n="d">alaṅə̄ mulatiṅ manuk aṅada-hadā ta larinya ləyəp</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 1 (b) L hīmavān -->
    320<lg n="2"><l n="a">vaṅiniṅ vanapuṣpa maluru kasirir ya ta maṅləṅəṅi</l>
    .<l n="b">tan arən maṅave tvasira tumaliṅe kətəriṅ bhramara</l>
    .<l n="c">kahiḍəp ta pañumbva nika kadi kətərniṅ amūrvva lulut</l>
    .<l n="d">araras sinamāntarakəna ri panavvaṅ ikaṅ mrak arūm</l>
    .</lg>
    325 <!-- 2 (a) Q kasilir -->
    .<lg n="3"><l n="a">i pasañcayaniṅ vanakusuma sumār mrik amr̥ṣṭy arurū</l>
    .<l n="b">rinarah təkapiṅ haṅin umirir aṅimbuhi raśmi nikā</l>
    .<l n="c">kadi layvan ikaṅ kusumaśara aneka vaneh suməlap</l>
    .<l n="d">i sukət-sukətiṅ luru-luruk anamar sinusuk-susukan</l>
    330</lg>
    . <!-- 3 (a) Q omits vana; S amrik -->
    .<lg n="4"><l n="a">nya sudanya latāṅalaya kapanasan kadi śoka rapuh</l>
    .<l n="b">katirah lumale sulur ika makuśā bhramitāmlas-arəp</l>
    .<l n="c">umiṅəl pva pakis haji nika hajapən yan avarṇa humə̄t</l>
    335<l n="d">hana rakva vəlas-harəp aṅulili muṅgv i parantyan akuṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 4 (d) S paraniyan -->
    .<lg n="5"><l n="a">aṅəlih səminiṅ maṅunəṅ asəmu lurva kəneṅ kiraṇa</l>
    .<l n="b">lvir aṅel maṅəsah lumayana ri ləməsnya maṅanti gərəh</l>
    340<l n="c">akiput kumisik gəsiṅ ikan aṅaveśa ri rəsniṅ unəṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">ri huyaṅnya kinolakəna* paməkuliṅ prabhu sanmata mār</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 5 (d) LQ kinolakən i -->
    .<lg n="6"><l n="a">agənət pva sukətnya puru-puru latāṅkura ketnyan arəs</l>
    345<l n="b">tuvi suṅsaṅ ikānvaṅi riy alikukunya luməṅhy aṅure</l>
    .<l n="c">suməkar ta kayənyan umadəg i juraṅnya sugandha mavit</l>
    .<l n="d">humənəṅ hana cəb luput ika duməliṅ ri vəgaṅnya luput</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 6 (c) S tayən -->
    350<lg n="7"><l n="a">ndah atīta lavas nr̥patanaya lumakv anusup riṅ alas</l>
    .<l n="b">kali durgga juraṅ giri gahana aneka linakva nira</l>
    .<l n="c">tuvi lālana met <hi rend="superscript">†</hi>paranira vulakan lvah anindya suci</l>
    .<l n="d">patapan ya ta rakva paṅinəpan ireka təhər hinivə̄<hi rend="superscript">†</hi></l>
    .</lg>
    355 <!-- 7 (c) L lālāna -->
    .<lg n="8"><l n="a">anusup ta muvah nr̥patanaya susatya mahāmirati</l>
    .<l n="b">ikanaṅ vana parvvata juga pakamitra nirān vinəgil</l>
    .<l n="c">ya ta rakva mahāsəgə-səgəhi sirāsaji sarvvaphala</l>
    .<l n="d">hana herttali rāmya ya tika suməneha patīrthan ira</l>
    360</lg>
    . <!-- 8 (b) L pakamitrān vinəgil (c) Q omits mahā-; S sumajya -->
    .<lg n="9"><l n="a">təka rakva sireṅ himagiri atisobha sabhānya katon</l>
    .<l n="b">ndan apiṇḍa kadevatan aləp ikaṅ ārkka lumə̄ṅ manisih</l>
    .<l n="c">kahatur jaladanya sumaput aputih kadi bapra ləṅə̄ṅ</l>
    365<l n="d">ahurup ləyəpiṅ gagana juga ləyəpnya kunəṅ tinahā</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 9 (a) L sureṅ for sireṅ (b) S anisih -->
    .</div>
    .<div type="canto" rend="met" n="3" met="śikhariṇī">
    370<lg n="1"><l n="a">savaṅ mosik tiṅkah ni para-parahiṅ parvvata ləṅə̄ṅ</l>
    .<l n="b">baṅun masyaṅ taṅ cāmara kumisik osah kapavanan</l>
    .<l n="c">halah herherən lvir ni pakusikaniṅ pādapa miṅəl</l>
    .<l n="d">lavan luṅlūṅanyan lalita maṅuṅaṅ lot maṅalaya</l>
    .</lg>
    375<lg n="2"><l n="a">ri himbaṅ-himbaṅnyān vana gahana udyāna juga ya</l>
    .<l n="b">katampvan krām-krāmniṅ kiraṇa karahanyān panəpuhi</l>
    .<l n="c">mamə̄ṅpə̄ṅ sāśry ārumpukana ta səkarnyeka dumilah</l>
    .<l n="d">kadi pvāhyas harṣān tinama-tama de paṇḍutanaya</l>
    .</lg>
    380<lg n="3"><l n="a">vināsvās tiṅkahniṅ halas ika savaṅ vāhv atamuyan</l>
    .<l n="b">pasuṅsuṅnya jrahniṅ kusuma suməkar kapva ya marūm</l>
    .<l n="c">tahən tejārumbut pracala mara sinvamnya hamirah</l>
    .<l n="d">hatur bāṅniṅ lambe gərəmə pasənāhanya ri sira</l>
    .</lg>
    385<lg n="4"><l n="a">ləbaknya kveh lvir nandanavana mahārāmya tan alah</l>
    .<l n="b">gihānyārcəp [h]endah prasama mahaləp varṇa racana</l>
    .<l n="c">lavan vr̥kṣanyāneka hana parijātānvam anəḍəṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">praləmba lvirniṅ pādapa nika mure lambika mapə̄s</l>
    .</lg>
    390 <!-- 4 (b) = LS -->
    .<lg n="5"><l n="a">nadīnyānūs ləṅləṅ mvaṅ i təla-təlāniṅ paraṅ arəs</l>
    .<l n="b">vaneh muñcār saṅkeṅ paras analaga lvir tasik anak</l>
    .<l n="c">ri duṅhus-duṅhusnyan rucira manaruh rūmniṅ udadhi</l>
    .<l n="d">prakīrṇā ṅ paṇḍanyāpuḍak anidəhi ṅ vuṅkal alaṅə̄</l>
    395</lg>
    .<lg n="6"><l n="a">saharṣāmbək saṅ pārtha makin umanek riṅ himagiri</l>
    .<l n="b">makin kāścaryyānon ri haləp ika sākṣāt surapada</l>
    .<l n="c">katuṅkul-tuṅkul denya para-parahiṅ bhāratapura</l>
    .<l n="d">ləbak luṅkan-luṅkan yy udaya śata tīrthān kalihatan</l>
    400</lg>
    . <!-- 6 (d) Q luṅka- -->
    .<lg n="7"><l n="a">juraṅ sūkṣmātyanteṅ bisama tuvi kalyañ jaladhara</l>
    .<l n="b">marok mvaṅ vəlkahniṅ valiraṅ aṅaras yan paṅəmuki</l>
    .<l n="c">kasə̄ṅan teja byakta tikin atəmah vaṅkava lumə̄ṅ</l>
    405<l n="d">pilih sə̄k truh ṅganyan lagi kinivatiṅ gəntər avarah</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 7 (b) L araras for aṅaras -->
    .<lg n="8"><l n="a">prabhāniṅ vve sākṣāt ya tiki kahanan nirmmalanadī</l>
    .<l n="b">pilih gaṅgādvāreki vinuni ri denyāparimita</l>
    410<l n="c">tumampaṅ* ta ṅvaṅ liṅnira tama tikin maṅkat aṅalih</l>
    .<l n="d">havanyāhrit priṅgākarakal i juraṅnyāriṅi-riṅi</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 8 (c) LR tumampā, S tumama ṅ -->
    .<lg n="9"><l n="a">ləvəs denyan mevəh taya gamananiṅ vvaṅ tama təkā</l>
    415<l n="b">yatan saṅ siddhārṣi pravara sira saṅ bhikṣuka huvus </l>
    .<l n="c">nahan pamyaktan kottamanira ta saṅ paṇḍūtanaya</l>
    .<l n="d">ndatan mevəh prāptān tamakəna sumadhyā parahita</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 9 (d) S parahite -->
    420<lg n="10"><l n="a">ḍatəṅ saṅ pārtha ṅkā ri kahanan ikaṅ kalyan asənə̄t</l>
    .<l n="b">katon pvekaṅ gaṅgāvivara paramānindya vimala</l>
    .<l n="c">anūs ri lvaṅniṅ gahvara mamulakan vvenya ya mulək</l>
    .<l n="d">apan sākṣāt hisniṅ śaśadhara huripniṅ sabhuvana</l>
    .</lg>
    425 <!-- 10 (c) LQ lyaṅ -->
    .<lg n="11"><l n="a">səḍəṅ prāpta ṅkā saṅ nr̥patanaya maṅkin sapurati</l>
    .<l n="b">tumiṅhal riṅ gaṅgāmr̥tamaya haturnyeka malilaṅ</l>
    .<l n="c">apan maṅgəh paṅdoh ni paṅavaśaniṅ tvas salahasa</l>
    .<l n="d">rikān masnānādyus sira tuməḍuniṅ tīrthavivara</l>
    430</lg>
    . <!-- 11 (b) Q ri (c) L paṅaveśa -->
    .</div>
    .<div type="canto" rend="met" n="4" met="praharṣiṇī">
    .<lg n="1"><l n="a">ṅkā rakvān salila ta saṅ narāryya pārtha</l>
    435<l n="b">lāgy ākə̄m ri vivaraniṅ nadī pavitra</l>
    .<l n="c">lyab-lyabnyātiśaya maveh manah viśuddha</l>
    .<l n="d">masvadhyāya japa sireka yan pamūjā</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="2"><l n="a">bvat nārīśvara sinamādhi sūkṣmatatva</l>
    440<l n="b">saṅkeṅ āṣṭadala haneṅ nadī pratiṣṭha</l>
    .<l n="c">sūryyātmā hinavatakən riṅ antarikṣa</l>
    .<l n="d">līna dhyāna ta mapisan ri vindudeva </l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="3"><l n="a">vvantən stry ārjja marək i saṅ narendraputra </l>
    445<l n="b">raśminyānamar ariniṅ raras maveh kuṅ</l>
    .<l n="c">sākṣāt karttika paṅavak nikaṅ kalaṅvan</l>
    .<l n="d">ləṅləṅniṅ vulan ajapən manis-manisnya</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="4"><l n="a">byaktāmuṅva ri ləṅəṅiṅ maṅə̄ vimūrccha</l>
    450<l n="b">varṇātruh riris alaṅə̄ patahnya mār mrik</l>
    .<l n="c">mvaṅ rupnyānələhi lanāməḍar kilatnya </l>
    .<l n="d">tejāniṅ muka gumavaṅ makin rinəṅga </l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 4 (c) Q rumnyā- -->
    455<lg n="5"><l n="a">ndan saṅ pārtha sira tikin təlas masandhyā</l>
    .<l n="b">kāṅgək cittanira tumonya tan pasaṅkan</l>
    .<l n="c"><foreign>lakṣmī</foreign>niṅ himagiri jahnavīki tan len</l>
    .<l n="d">yekān śaṅsaya tumahā riṅ indrajāla</l>
    .</lg>
    460 <!-- 5 (c) = L, K lakṣmi -->
    .<lg n="6"><l n="a">hetunyan paṅucap arūm paran kitāntən</l>
    .<l n="b">prāpteṅ parvvata ri səḍəṅkv atīrthayātra</l>
    .<l n="c">nāntən tan saparaniṅ aṅləṅə̄ṅ hiḍəpku</l>
    .<l n="d">āpan ratnaniṅ ahajə̄ṅ kitāri rakryan</l>
    465</lg>
    .<lg n="7"><l n="a">jañjan lvir* cumataka sambhave rarasta</l>
    .<l n="b">śrīniṅ tāman atava rūmnya yan vinimba</l>
    .<l n="c">śrīdantāmithuna manisnya riṅ vajākrām</l>
    .<l n="d">handul muṅgv i gisi-gisinya lot rumaṅkəp</l>
    470</lg>
    . <!-- 7 (a) LQ ṅvaṅ -->
    .<lg n="8"><l n="a">endah taṅ katirah aṅaśraye laṭinta</l>
    .<l n="b">mvaṅ nīlotpala ri matanta rūmnyan uṅgu</l>
    .<l n="c">luṅ hiṅ* jaṅga vahu lumuṅ vvaye gulūnta</l>
    475<l n="d">liṅkv induṅ maṅunəṅ amiṇḍa riṅ patah rūm</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 8 (b) = L, K nilotpala (c) Qniṅ -->
    .<lg n="9"><l n="a">kambaṅniṅ priyaka məkar yy avakta mambət</l>
    .<l n="b">[h]astāṅeraṅi səminiṅ haśoka ləṅləṅ</l>
    480<l n="c">ndah maṅkā ṅ vətis anusah tikuṅ puḍak mrik</l>
    .<l n="d">nyū dantāgəmuh anular ta yeṅ stanāhrit</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 9 (b) = LQ (c) Q omits ṅ -->
    .<lg n="10"><l n="a">nāhan rakva liṅira pārtha yan panantva</l>
    485<l n="b">vruh taṅ strīṅgita ni manah narendraputra</l>
    .<l n="c">he rakryan ləvu amanuṣya kabvatanta</l>
    .<l n="d">prāpta ṅke tuvi tak anon vaneh juga ṅvaṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 10 (a) Snira (c) Q amanuṣa (d) R inserts (vaṅ) before ṅvaṅ -->
    490<lg n="11"><l n="a">hāh tan popama mara gə̄ṅ nike kr̥tinta</l>
    .<l n="b">siddhāniṅ tumama mareṅ himādri durgga</l>
    .<l n="c">hīṅanyan putusiṅ inuttamādhikāra</l>
    .<l n="d">yogyan śāraṇa saṅ amet kavr̥ddhyaniṅ rāt</l>
    .</lg>
    495 <!-- 11 (d) R karaṇa for śāraṇa -->
    .<lg n="12"><l n="a">nā liṅnyāṅupasama tovi sārjjavāsih</l>
    .<l n="b">ndan saṅ phalguṇa mamanis vuvus <foreign>nirātvaṅ</foreign></l>
    .<l n="c">vīnaṅ dyah saṅ apa kitāhajə̄ṅ hana ṅke</l>
    .<l n="d">tājar ṅvaṅ duga-duga hāh ləvəs mahātku</l>
    500</lg>
    . <!-- 12 (b) MSS niratvaṅ (c) S mara for hana -->
    .<lg n="13"><l n="a">māskv īnduṅ [h]atava kitāri sūkṣmadevī</l>
    .<l n="b">vetnyan konəṅ-unəṅ anuṅgv i kāvakanta</l>
    .<l n="c">sakvehniṅ kusuma aṅasraye rarasta</l>
    505<l n="d">byaktekin hana rumagət katon panivya</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="14"><l n="a">pintəñ janma ni ləṅəṅiṅ kapat mavak rūm</l>
    .<l n="b">śrīniṅ sāgara madhu niṣkalāśarīra</l>
    .<l n="c">siṅhit pva ṅ jaladhi linaṅvakən laṅə̄nya</l>
    510<l n="d">lāvan parvvata vinaveṅ laṅə̄ salah de</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="15"><l n="a">rakryan tan viphala kunəṅ hayunta heman</l>
    .<l n="b">ṅke riṅ durgga gahana tovi tuṅga-tuṅgal</l>
    .<l n="c">lvir tan viśmaya matakut kiteṅ vanādri</l>
    515<l n="d">vetniṅ siṅha gaja ulāṅavit lavan moṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="16"><l n="a">maṅkā lvir nr̥patanayāməpər matakvan</l>
    .<l n="b">ndah mājar duga-duga teka saṅ sinantva</l>
    .<l n="c">rakryan rəṅvakəna nihan manəhta māsku</l>
    520<l n="d">strīkanyā ṅaran ulupuy ṅhulun pva yāsih</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="17"><l n="a">ndah pūrvvākəna mara janma ni ṅhulun strī</l>
    .<l n="b">śrī koravya ta karəṅə̄ gahan [h]ulā gə̄ṅ</l>
    .<l n="c">ndātan len ri sira mahādbhuteṅ prabhāva</l>
    525<l n="d">riṅ vīryyāpratihata tan sameṅ triloka</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 17 (b) = L -->
    .<lg n="18"><l n="a">vvantən rājya atiśayeṅ aləp viśeṣa</l>
    .<l n="b">deniṅ bhāsvara maṇi ratna aprameya</l>
    530<l n="c">lvir kendran hayu nika tan pacāla riṅ śrī</l>
    .<l n="d">kabvatnyān hana parijāta kalpavr̥kṣa</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="19"><l n="a">nā taṅ svargga tuvi masor hayunya kāsraṅ</l>
    .<l n="b">deniṅ nītala pakəkəs nikādvitīya</l>
    535<l n="c">[siṅgih yan daməlira padmayonideva]*</l>
    .<l n="d">hetunyāsama-sama vet ny ulih nirāmrih</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="20"><l n="a">nā <foreign>tāndəl</foreign>nira bhujagādhirāja tuṣṭi</l>
    .<l n="b">sakvehniṅ [h]uraga samanta kapva bhakti</l>
    540<l n="c">ndah parṇah ṅhulun iki nāgarājaputrī</l>
    .<l n="d">laṅgə̄ṅ sāśvata juga nora mātra duhka</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 20 (a) MSS tandəl; Lira (b) = L; Q manta -->
    .</div>
    545<div type="canto" rend="met" n="5" met="śārdūlavikrīḍita">
    .<lg n="1"><l n="a">sāntən-sāntən ikaṅ sukôttama huvus kesyan təkapniṅ yayah</l>
    .<l n="b">yāṅde vyāpara tar jənək saka ri gə̄ṅniṅ śreṣthi kady āvarəg</l>
    .<l n="c">āmbək tan vinaḍan mahāṅrarah i rūmniṅ deśa śūnyāsənə̄t</l>
    .<l n="d">prāpta ṅke dumadak manəmva ri kitādevāśrayeṅ jahnavī</l>
    550</lg>
    . <!-- 1 (b) Q tan (d) L -aśraye -->
    .<lg n="2"><l n="a">mogha ṅvaṅ kəna rāga tibra sinarik deniṅ smarāstrānala</l>
    .<l n="b">aṅhiṅ his ni manis-manista taḍahəñ jampya ny unəṅkun rimaṅ</l>
    .<l n="c">āpan hyaṅ rati marmma maṅrahatakən kiṅkiṅniṅ oghāṅaraṅ</l>
    555<l n="d">sih rakryan palarən varāmr̥ta kitātah pāvakiṅ manmatha</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="3"><l n="a">mvaṅ ndyānuṅ kahaləp nikaṅ vanavaśāṅanti ṅ* sukət kāsy-asih</l>
    .<l n="b">darppāṅiṅkis anambi riṅ vatu sumoṅ rukṣākusut nisprabhā</l>
    .<l n="c">roṇḍon lurv aluñut ya rakva kalaśānya ndin panəmva ṅ suka</l>
    560<l n="d">tan vāktan kəlutiṅ śarīra masamun kumrut riniṇḍiṅ lanā</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="4"><l n="a">saṅkṣəpanya tuhanku mantuka mareṅ nāgendrarājyāmriha</l>
    .<l n="b">bhuktin taṅ suka bhakti ni ṅhulun agə̄ṅ sambeganən tāṅhyaṅa</l>
    .<l n="c">nyāta ṅ nāga kabeh prabhakti tarimanta prārthananyānivi</l>
    565<l n="d">bhoga mvaṅ paribhoga yekana hivə̄n secchānavuṅ saṅgama</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 4 (d) S hivəh for hivə̄n -->
    .<lg n="5"><l n="a">nā liṅ saṅ hulupuy sarāga sumahur saṅ pārtha somyāmanis</l>
    .<l n="b">hāh māskv ību halib pva denta maṅalap ṅkāne maṇikniṅ hati</l>
    570<l n="c">heman raśmi nikuṅ prahāsana rasanyāmlad vaśāṅde təñuh</l>
    .<l n="d">santoṣāñ juga denta māsku ta kari ṅ niśśrādha sih ṅvaṅ hari</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 5 (b) Q balik for halib (d) Q tak kari; L nisśr̥dhā -->
    .<lg n="6"><l n="a">maṅke kālaniṅ aṅgəgə̄ pasamayan paṅde niraṅ nārada</l>
    575<l n="b">brāhmācāryya ya hetuniṅ malarasan ṅke riṅ himādry ānusup</l>
    .<l n="c">aṅhiṅ dvādaśa kāla hīṅan i lavasniṅ varṣa herən təkā</l>
    .<l n="d">yāṅde lə̄k yadiyan paṅisyana sarāgāmūrvvakən saṅgama</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 6 (a) L pasamayan i -->
    580<lg n="7"><l n="a">nāhan teki sahur saṅ arjjuna muvah mojar tikaṅ kāminī</l>
    .<l n="b">ḍū svāmiṅku salah tikāṅaṅən-aṅəntāmrih [r]yy ujar saṅ r̥ṣi</l>
    .<l n="c">vruh ṅvaṅ don i vuvus nirān gumavaya ṅ protsāha sambhodhana</l>
    .<l n="d">siṅgih śrī drupadātmajā sira tikāṅgəhniṅ bratantānaḍi</l>
    .</lg>
    585 <!-- 7 (b) = Q -->
    .<lg n="8"><l n="a">len saṅke rasikāparan ta kasalah dentāṅgəgə̄ saṅgama</l>
    .<l n="b">tan saṅkeṅ paraḍāra ləmpunən* ujarkv āmūrṣitāmrih rəṇa</l>
    .<l n="c">vr̥ddhyāniṅ kulavaṅśa donya pahayunta ṅ kāmamudrāgama</l>
    .<l n="d">nāhan bhyāsakəna prihən təpət ikaṅ dhyāyī təkeṅ śūnyata</l>
    590</lg>
    . <!-- 8 (b) LQ lampunən -->
    .</div>
    .<div type="canto" rend="met" n="6" met="turidagati">
    .<lg n="1"><l n="a">mapa kari citta saṅ nr̥patiputra hinuluran ujarnya met* sivi</l>
    595<l n="b">humənəb-ənəb ndan āmbəkira siṅgih ujar ikan aminta taṅgapən</l>
    .<l n="c">karaṇa nirān paṅayvakəna liṅnya hinubhayan apan pareṅ hayu</l>
    .<l n="d">apituvi tan pacāla riṅ arūm taya vipata kunəṅ hiḍəp nira</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 1 (a) LQ pet -->
    600<lg n="2"><l n="a">nda huvus atūt vilāśanira sotan i manahiṅ atuṅgalan hunəṅ</l>
    .<l n="b">aṅadəg adan ta rakva nr̥paputra dinulurira nāgakanyakā</l>
    .<l n="c">ri bəla[h] ikaṅ vasundara nahan ta havanira mare[ṅ] rasātala</l>
    .<l n="d">tuhun alaris sirāpaduluran suka tinuduh i tiṅkahiṅ hənū</l>
    .</lg>
    605 <!-- 2 (c) = LQ; = Q -->
    .<lg n="3"><l n="a">katəmu tikāṅ anālaya vaṅun-vaṅunan ika anopameṅ haləp</l>
    .<l n="b">racana nikaṅ humah kanaka gopura pagər ika kapva mās maṇik</l>
    .<l n="c">svaṅ asəmu tejamaṇḍala parəmpvan ika paḍa-paḍāmaṅun hulap</l>
    .<l n="d">iniṅət-iṅət hayunyan adhikāra saka ri hayuniṅ kadevatan</l>
    610</lg>
    . <!-- 3 (c) Q parəmpvin -->
    .<lg n="4"><l n="a">surabhavanāsinaṅ təkap ikaṅ dinakara vararatna bhāsvara</l>
    .<l n="b">hivag ika yan makāntaṅ akucəm lalu divasa ri kālaniṅ kuləm</l>
    .<l n="c">kunəṅ irikaṅ rasātala ya tāṅuraṅ-uraṅi pətəṅ təkeriya</l>
    615<l n="d">ya juga lanāsinaṅ təkap ikaṅ sphaṭika maṇi suteja nityasa</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 4 (a) L omits vara -->
    .<lg n="5"><l n="a">irika narendraputra tinamākəna təkapira nāgakāminī</l>
    .<l n="b">asaji haləp nikāṅ alaya kañcana pinacira vastv anindita</l>
    620<l n="c">hana vanitārjja kapva sinavaṅ maṇik aṅuray arūm raras nikā</l>
    .<l n="d">amuhara kuṅ liriṅnya dinələ̄ ləməs ikan aśarīra pādapa</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="6"><l n="a">vvaya ta marək sumaṅgraha maṅasvakəna pamapaganya riṅ tamuy</l>
    .<l n="b">apənəd avətva-vətvan i kapantəs ika ta magəsəṅ riṅ iṅgitā</l>
    625<l n="c">aləbu-ləbū raras ni saḍəkiṅ kusuma paḍa miṅiṅ kinasturi</l>
    .<l n="d">sinavava raśmi maṅjəṅərakən pasaji-saji manis tiniṅhalan</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 6 (a) R maṅsvakəna, S umaṅsvakəna (c) R rarab -->
    .<lg n="7"><l n="a">hana vaṅunan gr̥hasphaṭika paṅkaja madana hatəpnya mās tatur</l>
    630<l n="b">arəja rinəṅga puṣpamaya kapva maṇimaya lumə̄ṅ haneriya</l>
    .<l n="c">hana ta kunaṅ sumajya pavirāman ika gəlaraniṅ smarāstuti</l>
    .<l n="d">ndan inapi raśmisañcaya jahitnyan asəmu parahasyaniṅ vulan</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="8"><l n="a">irika ta muṅgahiṅ pakasutan saṅ ahayu kalavan nr̥pātmaja</l>
    635<l n="b">paṅavaśaniṅ paḍa priya matūt vavaṅ aruma[h] ikaṅ raras hati</l>
    .<l n="c">papupul irān haneṅ śayana rāmya paḍa sira makesiniṅ manis</l>
    .<l n="d">asəmu pamiṇḍaniṅ mənur aṅayvakəna raras arok lavan gaḍuṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 8 (b) = Q; S rarah -->
    640<lg n="9"><l n="a">hana ta vaneh patūtnira hatur salaga marək i rāmyaniṅ nadī</l>
    .<l n="b">niyata juga ṅ ratih makalavan manasija sira karva riṅ jinəm</l>
    .<l n="c">pavilət i sandhiniṅ gati ciniṇḍyanira tələṅ ikaṅ smarāgama</l>
    .<l n="d">kṣaṇika tatan kapaṅgila pasuṅsuṅan akəcap ireṅ pasaṅgaman</l>
    .</lg>
    645<lg n="10"><l n="a">kunəṅ i huvus nikaṅ gati təkap saṅ amithuna laṅə̄ nireṅ tilam</l>
    .<l n="b">vavaṅ alulut sirārddha kaharas maṇik i hati nirān hañar vaśi</l>
    .<l n="c">parəṅ umijil sirāśila makālihan ajajar i heṅ nikaṅ gr̥ha</l>
    .<l n="d">hana humaḍaṅ marək saparivāranira umupacāra saṅgraha</l>
    .</lg>
    650 <!-- 10 (a) S kunaṅ (b) S kaharan -->
    .<lg n="11"><l n="a">ri yava nikaṅ gr̥hasphaṭika parṇahira kadi sakeṅ smarālaya</l>
    .<l n="b">paḍa sumənāha taṅ taḍah aneka parama rasa pattya ṅ enaka</l>
    .<l n="c">ri təlas irānaḍah krama parəṅ ta sira maluy umuṅgaheṅ jinəm</l>
    .<l n="d">bətah anavuṅ hunəṅnira haneṅ śayana taya kavarśihiṅ gati</l>
    655</lg>
    . <!-- 11 (d) Q ṅka for bətah -->
    .<lg n="12"><l n="a">suka-suka saṅ səḍəṅ maṅayu raśmi saturida haneṅ pasaṅgaman</l>
    .<l n="b">tuvi pinagantakən mahasa lālana madulur anis mareṅ taman</l>
    .<l n="c">tan aləh ahimya-himyan aṅusir sakaləṅəṅan ikaṅ pajaṅ vulan</l>
    660<l n="d">sahaja marāṅrərəb-rərəb akālihana jinəm apuṣpa pādapa</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 12 (c) L iṅkaṅ -->
    .<lg n="13"><l n="a">paṅirim-irim nikaṅ masa kapat patər amijah aṅambvakən riris</l>
    .<l n="b">umahas-ahas ta rakva sira rāmya manəpərakəniṅ tapovana</l>
    665<l n="c">ṅuni-ṅuni riṅ nadītaṭa mareṅ juraṅ amarəki durgganiṅ paruṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">hana vulakan pamenanira lot aṭika-ṭikan asaṅva kuṅ lulut</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 13 (b) Qn anəpərakən -->
    .<lg n="14"><l n="a">salavas irāṅurən turida harṣa silih-asih aṅekacumbana</l>
    670<l n="b">vruh amiṣayeṅ rəsəp taya kagiṇḍalira paḍa sarāga tan vival</l>
    .<l n="c">jənək amuluṅ-muluṅ madanatantra taya kahala de dhanañjaya</l>
    .<l n="d">sinamaya sūkṣma liṅganiṅ akuṅ ndan apagəṭa mivə̄ ṅ karāsikan</l>
    .</lg>
    .</div>
    675<div type="canto" rend="met" n="7" met="jaloddhatagati">
    .<lg n="1"><l n="a">taṅeh lavas ireṅ rasātala hana</l>
    .<l n="b">ndatan dva mavəkādhikāra nipuna</l>
    .<l n="c">inakvanira vīra riṅ raṇa hələm</l>
    .<l n="d">ya rakva iravan ṅaranya karəṅə̄</l>
    680</lg>
    .<lg n="2"><l n="a">ndatan malupa saṅ narendratanaya</l>
    .<l n="b">prayojana jugeki nitya katutur</l>
    .<l n="c">ya hetuniṅ adan humaṅkata muvah</l>
    .<l n="d">sinantva vinarah ta saṅ priya huvus </l>
    685</lg>
    . <lg n="3"><l n="a">samaṅkana sirān lumakva maliha</l>
    .<l n="b">ḍatəṅ ri himavān ta rakva vəkasan</l>
    .<l n="c">visāta manusup sirāṅinak-inak</l>
    .<l n="d">aneka ta juraṅ vukir paranira</l>
    690</lg>
    . <!-- 3 (b) S riṅ -->
    .</div>
    .<div type="canto" rend="met" n="8" met="kāmamālā">
    .<note>Creese calls this meter Virat Təbu Sol.</note>
    695<lg n="1">
    .<l n="a">kaparah tikāṅ acala rāmya amanuṣa laṅə̄nya durggama</l>
    .<l n="b">giri nīlaśr̥ṅga karəṅə̄ tuvi gahana sukət nikaṅ vukir</l>
    .<l n="c">apəluk juraṅnyan adaləm śikara nika kahunduliṅ paruṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">kumisik bañunya ya manumbər i muka tuməḍun mareṅ juraṅ</l>
    700</lg>
    .<lg n="2"><l n="a">alilaṅ hilīnya gumulak maṅabarat i təlā nikaṅ vukir</l>
    .<l n="b">susuniṅ ləmah kahiḍəpanya kadi rajata varṇa bhāsvara</l>
    .<l n="c">amijah ḍaranya masibu mvaṅ akəpək aṅariṅ marambatan</l>
    .<l n="d">sakadaṅ matūt ndatan arinya mamarəṅi* patīrtha saṅ r̥ṣi</l>
    705</lg>
    . <!-- 2 (d) Q mamarəki -->
    .<lg n="3"><l n="a">alaləh katon para-parah nikin arəcəp aṅuṅkul-uṅkuli</l>
    .<l n="b">ri hiriṅ-hiriṅnya patapan mapaṅajaran i piṅgiriṅ paruṅ</l>
    .<l n="c">ndah atindu-tindu patatānya sana-sini paḍāgave laṅə̄</l>
    710<l n="d">vara puṣpadeha dumilah kadi dahana kinuṇḍa tan paḍəm</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 3 (c) S ndan -->
    .<lg n="4"><l n="a">araras patiṅhalan ikaṅ para kili vinagəd raras nikā</l>
    .<l n="b">kahatur cumāmpaka manisnya sumaji-saji tiṅhaliṅ mulat</l>
    715<l n="c">ri pasiṇḍi-siṇḍi nika pantəs aṅayati pakiñcaṅiṅ halis</l>
    .<l n="d">anamar kilaṅ juga liriṅnya vinulatan ikāṅhəmū-guyu </l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="5"><l n="a">i talun-talunya ya ta lālana hamumu* gaṅan lavañ jamūr</l>
    .<l n="b">ṅuniveh lalab paḍa vinuṅkus i jamaṅ ika tan taheṅ susu</l>
    720<l n="c">anusah manis riṅa-riṅan yan aṅiduṅ i samīpaniṅ paruṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">ahirit sinambaṅan ikaṅ gaguṅ asahuraniṅ juraṅ-juraṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 5 (a) LQ hamupu -->
    .<lg n="6"><l n="a">irikaṅ tapovana rarasnyan abuhaya sumajya saṅ r̥ṣi</l>
    725<l n="b">hana tāmipil kusuma darbbha hinikət inamərnya riṅ kukū</l>
    .<l n="c">savaneh mareṅ ghaṭa lumampah aṅamər arəjāñavuk bañu</l>
    .<l n="d">dinələ̄ manisnyan aṅənoh ruməṅu-rəṅu savaṅ surāpsarī</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="7"><l n="a">anəḍək tikaṅ tasik anak bañu nikan inuṅaṅ katuṅkulan</l>
    730<l n="b">kumucup taṅ erttali sakeṅ vivara niki kavantusiṅ təṅah</l>
    .<l n="c">amaṅun-maṅun hima lumə̄ṅ kakiraṇan atəmah kuvuṅ-kuvuṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">savaneh katon kapaləyə̄ kadi bhujaga kuməṇḍəṅ aṅlayaṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 7 (b) S kumucur (d) R kumənḍam, S kumənḍḍəm -->
    735<lg n="8"><l n="a">səminiṅ vanāntara lume məhah aṅayam-ayam truhiṅ nadī</l>
    .<l n="b">kadi tan pujin marək i rūmnya pinakaciri muṅgu riṅ gəluṅ</l>
    .<l n="c">ri ḍatəṅ narendratanayāṅdurugakəna laṅə̄niṅ aśrama</l>
    .<l n="d">huniniṅ kuvoṅ lvir aṅatag mijila hana ta saṅ dhanañjaya</l>
    .</lg>
    740</div>
    .<div type="canto" rend="met" n="9" met="pr̥thvītala">
    .<lg n="1">
    .<l n="a">rəsəp ta siraṅ āryya phalguṇa tikin mulat kāsrəpan</l>
    .<l n="b">katon haləp ikaṅ pradeśa nikanaṅ vukir pājaran</l>
    745<l n="c">lumūd manah irān rapuh kaṅəlihan təkapniṅ ravi</l>
    .<l n="d">ya kāraṇa nirān tan aśru vəkasan savetnyān maṅel</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 1 (a) S pasrəpan (d) L tan sru -->
    .<lg n="2"><l n="a">hanan laku suməṅka rāmya lumihat hiriṅniṅ laṅit</l>
    750<l n="b">linaṅvakən ikaṅ manuk vahu mulih larinyālaṅə̄</l>
    .<l n="c">tuvi pvan alaləh lapat-lapat aḍanta-ḍantāṅlayaṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">ya rakva sumave raras tvas anamar kəḍapniṅ vukir</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 2 (c) Q lumatlapa ta danta -->
    755<lg n="3"><l n="a">havan ləṅəṅ atuṇḍa-tuṇḍa təpiniṅ juraṅnyādaləm</l>
    .<l n="b">ikaṅ sukət anambi-nambir asənə̄t latānyān sumoṅ</l>
    .<l n="c">luməṅhay adavā katon luṅ i galiṅnya muṅgviṅ paruṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">hanekin amilət ri ampiji vaneh tahənyāləsəs</l>
    .</lg>
    760<lg n="4"><l n="a">larap ni səminiṅ valik-kaḍəp i himbaṅiṅ pājaran</l>
    .<l n="b">lavan pisaṅ alas pupus nika mapə̄s hatur kāṅlihan</l>
    .<l n="c">savaṅ layu-layū lumimbay alaris səḍəṅ kāṅinan</l>
    .<l n="d">aganti lavan aṇḍurū ya tan arən kəlabnyāṅave</l>
    .</lg>
    765 <!-- 4 (a) Q valik-aḍəp (d) L andarū -->
    .<lg n="5"><l n="a">samaṅkana pamaṅsuliṅ kidaṅ avās manisnyān vulat</l>
    .<l n="b">mulat ḍara-ḍaran [n]ikaṅ vray irikaṅ tahən sambrama</l>
    .<l n="c">sumantən anacar ta sarvvaphala honya maṅhruk parəṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">dudū taṅ aṅariṅ lutuṅnya yan amaṅkukiṅ pāṅ jənək</l>
    770</lg>
    .<lg n="6"><l n="a">taṅeh yan inivə̄n samāntara ḍatəṅ sireṅ aśrama</l>
    .<l n="b">katon kadi sumaṅgrahe sira kayunya kumrām kabeh</l>
    .<l n="c">səkarnya vilajeṅ ləmah kadi rurū nikaṅ bhūṣaṇa</l>
    .<l n="d">aṅutkaṭa sumār nirāntara vaṅinya lumrā marūm</l>
    775</lg>
    . <!-- 6 (b) S omits stanzas 6b-10a -->
    .<lg n="7"><l n="a">lalu ṅ ghaṭita māsa tistis ahavan ta saṅ hyaṅ ravi</l>
    .<l n="b">sirəm-sirəm i səbsəbiṅ kiraṇa kālasandhyā huvus</l>
    .<l n="c">avarṇa cinirup tikaṅ gagana tumraṅ abhrāmirah</l>
    780<l n="d">urutnya sumirat-sirat karudhiran panarkeriya</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 7 (a) L tīstis -->
    .<lg n="8"><l n="a">makin kavuvuhan laṅə̄ racananiṅ pavitrāśrama</l>
    .<l n="b">tuvin kinəmulan kusut ni jaladanya lumrānurun</l>
    785<l n="c">inayvan i kukus nikaṅ huti pamūja saṅ paṇḍita</l>
    .<l n="d">ikaṅ kaluṣa moha śīrṇa tilakanya sākṣāt gəsə̄ṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="9"><l n="a">mirir vaṅi nikaṅ pahoman i daləmnya mavrā sumār</l>
    .<l n="b">sugandha saha dhūpa ḍīpa humaras vaṅinyāṅasut</l>
    790<l n="c">samanta jayaghaṇṭa-ghaṇṭi ya tikin paṅuṅkuṅ parəṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">lavan stava karəṅv asaṅghani malap tvas aṅde ləṅə̄ṅ</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="10"><l n="a">manuknyan akule lanān pakuləman rikāṅ aśrama</l>
    .<l n="b">humuṅ mahurahan kəcəknyan amicāra varṇākṣara</l>
    795<l n="c">ləṅə̄ṅ panamayiṅ dvirepa karəṅə̄ haneṅ srak miṅiṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">baṅun vruh aṅavat lalitya paṅiduṅnya somyārərəh</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 10 (c) Q panayam for panamay -->
    .<lg n="11"><l n="a">aneka ta tinon [n]arendrasuta rāmyaniṅ pājaran</l>
    800<l n="b">ya teka magave kapūhanira tuṣṭa māntən rapuh</l>
    .<l n="c">maṅə̄ miṅət-iṅət marāryyan irikaṅ śilālvāratā</l>
    .<l n="d">aṅanty aṅinəpiṅ tapovana nahan tatāmbək nira</l>
    .</lg>
    .</div>
    805<div type="canto" rend="met" n="10" met="kāmamālā">
    .<note>Creese calls this meter Virat Təbu Sol.</note>
    .<lg n="1">
    .<l n="a">ndah ivə̄n ta saṅ r̥ṣi kabeh mijil agaravalan panuṅsuṅa</l>
    .<l n="b">tapi-tapy adandan umijil sahananira haneṅ tapovana</l>
    810<l n="c">ndan apadgaṭāməkasakən* daluvaṅira təhər ndatan hiner</l>
    .<l n="d">agiraṅ-giraṅ lumihatiṅ lituhayu ya tikāṅjəṅər hati</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="2"><l n="a">kadunuṅ ta saṅ nr̥patiputra ta maśila ri pə̄haniṅ tapa</l>
    .<l n="b">apənəd ri sor nikaṅ aśoka maṅisapu ya tāsuhun səkar</l>
    815<l n="c">mututuṅ ta saṅ r̥ṣi tumiṅhali sira parameṅgitāhaləp</l>
    .<l n="d">yadiyan mucap kusumacāpa valiṅira mulat məṅən[-məṅən]</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 2 (c) L matuṅtuṅ for mututuṅ (d) = LQ -->
    .<lg n="3"><l n="a">tan alah kapūhan ika saṅ para kili kadi vismr̥ti ṅ hiḍəp</l>
    820<l n="b">svaṅ anagva-nagvakən unaṅnya ri mata rasa tan vənaṅ hinə̄t</l>
    .<l n="c">mavuvus ta saṅ r̥ṣi sabhāgya mami manarukeṅ tapovana</l>
    .<l n="d">katəkān manəmva phala ni ṅvaṅ amirati ḍatəṅ nr̥pātmaja</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 3 (d) Q anirati -->
    825<lg n="4"><l n="a">mapa taṅ prayojana narendratanaya mahasiṅ vanāntara</l>
    .<l n="b">kadi tambayiṅ parama māryya gatarasa mamī vanāśrama</l>
    .<l n="c">təpətiṅ samāhita kunaṅ pinahayu hayuiṅ tapabrata</l>
    .<l n="d">takari ṅ kr̥tārtha paṅaranya panuluyana denta sanmata</l>
    .</lg>
    830<lg n="5"><l n="a">na vuvus vatək r̥ṣi narendrasuta majar i saṅ mahāyati</l>
    .<l n="b">atərəh pva denira yathārthanira ḍatəṅ atīrtha kāraṇa</l>
    .<l n="c">riy ulih nireṅ nitala yeka ta vinarahakən təkap nira</l>
    .<l n="d">agiraṅ ta saṅ r̥ṣi ruməṅva kadi kavuvuhan sukābuṅah</l>
    .</lg>
    835 <!-- 5 (a) R inserts (vatək) before mahāyati -->
    .<lg n="6"><l n="a">vəkasan ta saṅ nr̥patiputra dinulur umulih riṅ aśrama</l>
    .<l n="b">ri ḍatəṅ nirān pinaripoṣita təkapira saṅ vatək r̥ṣi</l>
    .<l n="c">hana tārggha pādya saha mūlaphala lavan ikaṅ mahoṣadhi</l>
    .<l n="d">suka saṅ dhanañjaya kaveni manahira təkap mahāmuni</l>
    840</lg>
    .<lg n="7"><l n="a">iti nā səḍəṅ nr̥patiputra hana ta sira riṅ tapovana</l>
    .<l n="b">pinaran-paran ta sira de para yati malulut mare sira</l>
    .<l n="c">mahasiṅ tapovana vinūrṣita saparan ire mahāyati</l>
    .<l n="d">nda aneka denira maharsuka ri sira vatək mahājana</l>
    845</lg>
    . <!-- 7 (b) Q mahāyati -->
    .<lg n="8"><l n="a">pira teki rakva ri lavasniran aməgil i saṅ mahāyati</l>
    .<l n="b">kadi tan haneki dumage samanahira parārtha nityasa</l>
    .<l n="c">irikā sirāmuhun umaṅkata ri sira saṅ ugrapaṇḍita</l>
    850<l n="d">karəṇan mahāmuni kumolakəna ta sira saṅ nr̥pātmaja</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="9"><l n="a">bapa saṅ paṅə̄baniṅ anāśraya parahita dharmma riṅ prajā</l>
    .<l n="b">katəkān manəmva suka riṅ kadi kita guṇavān ṅhulun tuhan</l>
    .<l n="c">nyata saṅ mahājana tamolahiṅ acala kita prayojana</l>
    855<l n="d">kita māsihānulusakən patayaśa pinakāśrayeṅ hayu</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="10"><l n="a">na vuvus dvijarṣi sira saṅ nr̥patanaya təhər umaṅkata</l>
    .<l n="b">mahavan halas-halas ikaṅ paṅajaran i siluk nikaṅ vukir</l>
    .<l n="c">irikaṅ nadī siran atīrtha maharaḍin ikaṅ kasatvikan</l>
    860<l n="d">maliheṅ purāntara kunəṅ parananira sinambrameṅ suka</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="11"><l n="a">vvaya teki bhūpati hinuttama suyaśa mahārddhikeṅ praja</l>
    .<l n="b">sinivi ṅ mayūra vararājya nagaranira saṅ nareśvara</l>
    .<l n="c">karəṅə̄ pva saṅjñanira citradahana tuhu bhūmipālaka</l>
    865<l n="d">satatāsiheṅ agati tan vijigi siran anon nirārthakā</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 11 (c) L sajña -->
    .</div>
    . <div type="canto" rend="met" n="11" met="rajanī">
    870<lg n="1"><l n="a">sira ta narendra citradahanānak anindya hayu</l>
    .<l n="b">kadi paśarīraniṅ raras amiṇḍa ri gātra nira</l>
    .<l n="c">svaṅ avaṅi gandhaniṅ kusuma tan pagap arddha marəs</l>
    .<l n="d">mataṅ ika citragandha panəṅərnira rājasutā</l>
    .</lg>
    875<lg n="2"><l n="a">apituvi rakva buddhi naranātha yayān masəkəl</l>
    .<l n="b">gatinira tuṅga-tuṅgala makesi ni nāla nira</l>
    .<l n="c">bisama ya tan kagantyana dəlāha hiḍəp nr̥pati</l>
    .<l n="d">karaṇa nirān viraṅrvaṅ i karākṣakaniṅ nagara</l>
    .</lg>
    880<lg n="3"><l n="a">paṅayam-ayam niraṅ nr̥pati mahyun amantva məne </l>
    .<l n="b">ya ta pinametakəñ jalu sulakṣana tan kahala</l>
    .<l n="c">makaphala vaṅśajā sumiliheṅ pura len karatun</l>
    .<l n="d">alah apəgā ṅ manah maṅən-aṅən ryy abhilāśa nira</l>
    .</lg>
    885<lg n="4"><l n="a">syapa kari saṅ mahānipuna vastu vineh atikā</l>
    .<l n="b">maran aharəp mahalvakəna tan baśa yan kavavā</l>
    .<l n="c">niyata kaduryyaśan liṅira tuccha gatinya təmən</l>
    .<l n="d">tan ulahaniṅ janottama yadin parateṅ vipata</l>
    .</lg>
    890 <lg n="5"><l n="a"> hana mara tôpamanya ta kunaṅ yadiyan varaṅən</l>
    .<l n="b">kusuma səḍəṅ manohara sumambyakəniṅ bhramara</l>
    .<l n="c">ləvu mara denya yogya hañaṅənya varəg juga ya</l>
    .<l n="d">ya paṅupadr̥ṣtaniṅ taruṇa moliha tan vibaśa</l>
    .</lg>
    895<lg n="6"><l n="a">karaṇa nirāsəkəl taya maṅenaki buddhi nira</l>
    .<l n="b">luluy aṅajap ndatan palalayan tvas irābayaṅan</l>
    .<l n="c">ṅuni-ṅuni tekanaṅ bala kadi pva ya niśśaraṇa</l>
    .<l n="d">taya mara ṅūni liṅnya sahananya məhah malara</l>
    .</lg>
    900 <!-- 6 (c) S tikanaṅ -->
    .<lg n="7"><l n="a">tuvi mara kārmmaniṅ dadi ikaṅ rva tumūt mijila</l>
    .<l n="b">hala hayu yeka rakva tinəmunya lanā manapəl</l>
    .<l n="c">paḍa-paḍa tan kasah pva ya rikaṅ dadi janma kabeh</l>
    .<l n="d">sudhana kr̥pāna len ganal alit taya tan kahana</l>
    905</lg>
    .<lg n="8"><l n="a">vvaṅ alupa riṅ rasāgama anāḍi Śivasmaraṇa</l>
    .<l n="b">niyata nikān panəmva hivəhiṅ dadi tan ləpasa</l>
    .<l n="c">kathamapi saṅ mayūrapati satvika lot ginəgə̄</l>
    .<l n="d">panəmu nireṅ inak ruḍita śoka marək maṅikū</l>
    910</lg>
    . <!-- 8 (b) Q panəmbah for panəmva -->
    .<lg n="9"><l n="a">ya tika ginopiteṅ hr̥daya gə̄ṅ ni kaduhkan ira</l>
    .<l n="b">ya juga lanā linālana vinehnira tan masukər</l>
    .<l n="c">pasisi vanāntarāśrama nahan ta pamenan ira</l>
    915<l n="d">bari-bari yeka rakva paṅimūr pva ri suṅsut ira</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="10"><l n="a">pira ta kunəṅ lavasnira narādhipa rañca makuṅ</l>
    .<l n="b">tinuduh i siṅhitiṅ manah aṅiṣṭy avasāna nira</l>
    .<l n="c">pamahayuniṅ hyaṅ aṅdani ḍatəṅnira pārtha məne</l>
    920<l n="d">niyata sireka maṅruvagi suṅkava saṅ nr̥pati</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="11"><l n="a">tuvi karəṅə̄ ta rakva hayu saṅ vara rājasutā</l>
    .<l n="b">aṅətərakən raras ni ləṅəṅiṅ giri māryy alaṅə̄</l>
    .<l n="c">kalavan ikaṅ vilāpa kadi māntəna rūmnya larut</l>
    925<l n="d">karaṇa nirān ḍatəṅ kavava de ni karəṅvan ira</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="12"><l n="a">prakaśita yan ḍatəṅ pravara paṇḍusute nr̥pati</l>
    .<l n="b">sipi kari gə̄ṅ i buddhi naranātha sirātamuyan</l>
    .<l n="c">atava kəta ṅ balāmala-malar taya len ri sira</l>
    930<l n="d">kadi salagālabəh ri təkaniṅ ririsiṅ jalada</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 12 (b) S ni for i -->
    .<lg n="13"><l n="a">sahaja savaṅ mahodadhi katonan ikaṅ nagara</l>
    .<l n="b">gumuru[h] ikaṅ vvaṅiṅ pura mijil ya tikin kətəra</l>
    935<l n="c">ndan asəmu candrapūrṇa nr̥paputra sumə̄ṅ iriya</l>
    .<l n="d">ya ta karaṇanya sə̄k turida lot kumisik maṅəsah</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 13 (b) = LQ -->
    .<lg n="14"><l n="a">iniṅət-iṅət haləpnira narendrasutātiśaya</l>
    940<l n="b">madana basanta komala lavan madhumāsa ḍatəṅ</l>
    .<l n="c">tuvin anivaryyaśakti lituhayv aguṇeṅ samara</l>
    .<l n="d">nr̥pasuta kevalāta viṣaya ny ucapanya vagus</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="15"><l n="a">irika ta saṅ nareśvara marək ri narendrasuta</l>
    945<l n="b">vulat amanis panuṅsuṅira sārjjava buddhi nira</l>
    .<l n="c">ruməsəp i nāla saṅ vahu ḍatəṅ ta panantva nira</l>
    .<l n="d">sipi kari bhāgyamānta mami vet ni ḍatəṅta laki</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="16"><l n="a">kadi tr̥ṇavr̥kṣa [rukṣa] makirih ya paḍaṅkva huvus </l>
    950<l n="b">hinilan ikaṅ hudan bisama kuṅnya maṅel aṅajap</l>
    .<l n="c">kavadiy uyaṅnya kāvit asəvə̄ pva ya niskaraṇa</l>
    .<l n="d">amənaṅi sih bhaṭāra suranātha tahāṅkva kita</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 16 (a) = LQ (d) Q sihta; S tahāṅkvi -->
    955<lg n="17"><l n="a">kalavan ikiṅ kaḍatvan atiśuṣka ləvəs viphala</l>
    .<l n="b">kadi hana ta svakārmma nika gāryyaṅ atah makucəm</l>
    .<l n="c">hana mara gantaniṅ hayu kapaṅgiha denya məne</l>
    .<l n="d">kuśala guṇanta mūlya aməṅanyan amuktya hayu</l>
    .</lg>
    960<lg n="18"><l n="a">vacana narendra harṣa mavuvus ta narendrasuta</l>
    .<l n="b">taha mara liṅta nātha katuluy pva mahā maṅuḍaṅ </l>
    .<l n="c">parama kasajjananta atiśuddha parārtha vibhuh</l>
    .<l n="d">suməkar i padmaniṅ hati mataṅnya sumeva haji</l>
    .</lg>
    965<lg n="19"><l n="a">irika ta yan pinintanira saṅ vararājasuta*</l>
    .<l n="b">taya vinihaṅ narāryya ri mayūra papātra nira</l>
    .<l n="c">bapa halapənta māsku sivinənya kiteki baśa</l>
    .<l n="d">nya pahalavə̄nta teki punagiṅkva pakīrtyakəna</l>
    .</lg>
    970 <!-- 19 (a) Q rajaputra (b) S papātran -->
    .<lg n="20"><l n="a">prathama nikiṅ mayūra vararājya rəṅə̄nta harah</l>
    .<l n="b">prabhu sira saṅ prabhākara nahan ta ravitkva sira</l>
    .<l n="c">ati malavas r adəgnira tan ora tanūja haji</l>
    .<l n="d">lumaku sirāgave tapa maṅiṣṭya anak ya ta don</l>
    975</lg>
    . <!-- 20 (c) Q tan nora -->
    .<lg n="21"><l n="a">karuṇa ta saṅ hyaṅ Ïśvara katon dr̥dha saṅ nr̥pati </l>
    .<l n="b">təhər aṅanugrahānaka savijya atah ri sira</l>
    .<l n="c">katəka-təke svaputrakula maṅkana hayva vaneh</l>
    980<l n="d">ya tika tinūt ni vījanira yan hana riṅ nagara</l>
    .</lg>
    .</div>
    . <div type="canto" rend="met" n="12" met="rucira">
    .<lg n="1">
    985<l n="a">təvək nikaṅ viṣama kabhukty aveh suma</l>
    .<l n="b">taya ṅ purākr̥ta masəvə̄ vyamohita </l>
    .<l n="c">nya saṅhulun kavəkas anak varāṅgana</l>
    .<l n="d">katon pva tan təhər agave prajāṅhita</l>
    .</lg>
    990 <!-- 1 (a) Q suka for suma (c) S riya for nya -->
    .<lg n="2">
    .<l n="a">hudāśinanta bapa sinambhavāsiha</l>
    .<l n="b">ikāṅ anak jalu ya pininta ni ṅhulun</l>
    .<l n="c">yayānaka ṅhulun inahā gumantyana</l>
    995<l n="d">pratiṣṭhiteṅ nagara ya sulkakanyakā</l>
    .</lg>
    . <lg n="3">
    .<l n="a">ahan vuvusnira nr̥paputra tan cala</l>
    .<l n="b">inakvakən ryy anaka narendrakanyakā</l>
    1000<l n="c">jalu prasiddha sumiliheryy adəgnira </l>
    .<l n="d">samāpta pāyuniṅ ubhayenalapkəna</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 3 (a) Q nire -->
    .<lg n="4">
    1005<l n="a">huvus suvārddhana para taṇḍa de haji</l>
    .<l n="b">panivya saṅ nr̥paduhite saṅ arjjuna</l>
    .<l n="c">saharṣa taṅ bala ruməṅə̄ ta tan vihaṅ</l>
    .<l n="d">pajātyaniṅ manivi susatya maṅkana</l>
    .</lg>
    1010 <!-- 4 (b) L -duhīte (c) L balā -->
    .<lg n="5">
    .<l n="a">vavaṅ dine tikaṅ upakāraniṅ smara </l>
    .<l n="b">pasaṅgrahe siran anavuṅ haneṅ jinəm</l>
    .<l n="c">vavaṅ ndatan kahala kabeh paḍāṅhaḍā</l>
    1015<l n="d">subaddha pūrṇa vali nirāsameṅ hayu</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="6">
    .<l n="a">ikaṅ vvaṅiṅ pura ruməṅə̄ yathāsuka</l>
    .<l n="b">paḍāmahayvakən agave pamūrṣita</l>
    1020<l n="c">vaneh madan hyas ika samenakeṅ tamuy</l>
    .<l n="d">ikaṅ kətəg-kətəg araras rinūpakā</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="7">
    .<l n="a">haneki saṅgraha gr̥ha rāmya kottama</l>
    1025<l n="b">ri de nikāparimita vr̥nda riṅ haləp</l>
    .<l n="c">anopameṅ racana kinantaniṅ raṇu</l>
    .<l n="d">savaṅ himālaya ri haturnya komala</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="8">
    1030<l n="a">nahan parantyanira ta saṅ dhanañjaya</l>
    .<l n="b">aneka taṅ surasa pasajya pāvvata</l>
    .<l n="c">sənāha taṅ marək umivə̄ hanāṅavat</l>
    .<l n="d">sinaṅkyaniṅ paḍahi lalitya len kətur</l>
    .</lg>
    1035<lg n="9">
    .<l n="a">surup nikaṅ ravi umulih narādhipa</l>
    .<l n="b">taya ṅ kasaṅśayanira buddhi sāśvata</l>
    .<l n="c">savet ni gə̄ṅ i manah ire dhanañjaya</l>
    .<l n="d">panonaniṅ suka mijileṅ mukābuṅah</l>
    1040</lg>
    .</div>
    .<div type="canto" rend="met" n="13" met="kusumavilasita">
    .<lg n="1">
    .<l n="a">prāpta narendra riṅ gr̥ha cumuṇḍuk i kahanan i saṅ nareśvarī</l>
    1045<l n="b">lāgi sinuṅsuṅiṅ smita ḍatəṅnira tinamakəniṅ vulat marūm</l>
    .<l n="c">denira saṅ narendramahiṣī dadi mavara-varah nareśvara</l>
    .<l n="d">[r]yy ārtha nikaṅ prayojana məne kavaraṅanira saṅ suputrikā</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 1 (c) L mahiṣi (d) = Q -->
    1050<lg n="2">
    .<l n="a">tan vinihaṅ təkap nr̥pavadhū yugalanira narendrakanyakā</l>
    .<l n="b">maṅkana teki saṅ vvaṅ i daləm paḍa gərəmə hanāsəvə̄h lulut</l>
    .<l n="c">saṅ nr̥paputra liṅnya sira vastu savava pamave suputrikā</l>
    .<l n="d">ndā * havivākṣitan krama parəṅ narapati parateṅ suputrikā</l>
    1055</lg>
    . <!-- 2 (d) MSS nda -->
    .<lg n="3">
    .<l n="a">tan dva ḍatəṅ ta rakva naranātha kunəṅ iki narendraputrikā</l>
    .<l n="b">arddha viraṅrvaṅ epu ruməṅə̄ samanahira ta saṅ narādhipa</l>
    1060<l n="c">prāpta ta saṅ narendra ri sirāmuhara salahasān kinə̄lakən</l>
    .<l n="d">luhnira lot pinə̄m tuhun anuṅsuṅ i təkanira saṅ narādhipa</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="4">
    .<l n="a">marmma manah nikaṅ vvaṅ i daləm ri viṅitira sumə̄ṅ mənəb-mənəb</l>
    1065<l n="b">kveh paricārikānvam aṅiriṅ paḍa vihikaniṅ iṅgite sira</l>
    .<l n="c">denya marək manimbaṅi katonan ikan asəmu pañjrahiṅ mənur</l>
    .<l n="d">śrī nr̥paputrikāmava laṅə̄nyan amuṅari hatur niśākara</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="5">
    1070<l n="a">kāla nirān panəmbah alaris luṅayaniran amādapālume</l>
    .<l n="b">ambət ikaṅ təṅah savava rosnya pañuriganiṅ aṅga tan siṅi</l>
    .<l n="c">tovin arūm katon kirab i gātranira təkap i tejaniṅ damar</l>
    .<l n="d">byakta vənəs nikaṅ muka savaṅ vulan aluru vaśāṅrəsi ṅ hati</l>
    .</lg>
    1075<lg n="6">
    .<l n="a">ṅkān paṅucap narādhipa muvah nr̥pavaramahisī suputrikā</l>
    .<l n="b">om rari tan vaneh kita lanā pinala-palar apuṇya ri ṅhulun</l>
    .<l n="c">rūmta ya kesyananta atavānulusakəna hajə̄ṅ suputrikā</l>
    .<l n="d">ṅhiṅ kita tāsyasih karaṇaniṅ tuməkakəna mareṅ nirātmakā</l>
    1080</lg>
    .<lg n="7">
    .<l n="a">rakryan arebu māsku takari ṅ kita rari hinarəp-harəp mami</l>
    .<l n="b">lāmpun ujarku denta riṅ apāku lumugasana sihkva putrikā</l>
    .<l n="c">vet ni tuvuhta sāmpun anəḍəṅ sapaṅalapan akārmma tan sali</l>
    1085<l n="d">ndah sira saṅ dhanañjaya sivinta sira saphala sambhave kita</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 7 (a) Q təmən for mami -->
    . <lg n="8">
    .<l n="a">maṅkana liṅ nareśvara kunaṅ nr̥pavaraduhitā ndatan sahur</l>
    1090<l n="b">mepu təkāṅadəh luhira kāsrək i manahira tan vriṅ olaha</l>
    .<l n="c">rəsnira yan lumaṅghaṇa pakon narapati ri sirāmaṅun səkəl</l>
    .<l n="d">hetu nirān məhah juga taṅeh yan amituhu ri saṅ yayah bibi</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 8 (a) L duhītā -->
    1095<lg n="9">
    .<l n="a">ndah mavuvus narendramahisī tuhan ibu naranātha siṅgihən </l>
    .<l n="b">tan hana rakva lena ri kitebu makalarapaniṅ tvaṅ i ṅhulun</l>
    .<l n="c">vandhavavargga puṇyakəna denta yat anuvuha jalva putraja</l>
    .<l n="d">tan maliheṅ mayūra ya ta paṅgajaha nagara sulkakanyakā</l>
    1100</lg>
    . <!-- 9 (d) Q paṅgajahana -->
    .<lg n="10">
    .<l n="a">toh palalu nda hayva tumahā nr̥pati mubura dharmma saṅ prabhu</l>
    .<l n="b">prārthana saṅ masūnva varabhāryya hana kari hivəhnya sūṅakən</l>
    1105<l n="c">piṅgiṅ ikaṅ katalyana ri sihniṅ atanaya mahəlya duryyaśa</l>
    .<l n="d">hātnya tatan kənenaku ikaṅ hala hayu panəmunya riṅ prajā</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 10 (a) Q palalun -->
    .<lg n="11">
    1110<l n="a">sāmpun irān ghumoṣita mulih narapati kavəkas suputrikā</l>
    .<l n="b">śoka tinuntuniṅ kaka amogha malumay agəyuh kakiṅkiṅan</l>
    .<l n="c">prāpta sireṅ daləm gr̥halatā prihati pamatəkiṅ kakanyakan</l>
    .<l n="d">kevala luhnira drava makin hinari-hari linālaneṅ kaka</l>
    .</lg>
    1115 <!-- 11 (b) L śokā; L omits kaka -->
    .</div>
    .<div type="canto" rend="met" n="14" met="mattarāga">
    .<lg n="1"><l n="a">strī-strī haneṅ nagara ləṅləṅ osik aṅaraṅ linurvaniṅ unəṅ</l>
    .<l n="b">bhrantālaṅə̄ kasarikiṅ manis nr̥patiputra tibra maṅani</l>
    1120<l n="c">mogāhuyaṅ hamuni kuṅnya moyut amajaṅ śaśāṅka ri daləm</l>
    .<l n="d">maṅkin tinəṅv an ahavan vulan ḍatəṅ irān panūkṣma turida</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="2"><l n="a">ānyāt ta moruk aṅure rikaṅ patiga mūrcchitāṅrəs asuma</l>
    .<l n="b">kiṅkiṅnya lāgi tinatānya riṅ sumanasālaṅə̄ dadi ṭikā</l>
    1125<l n="c">denyāmisik-misiki ceṭi kānya laraniṅ rimaṅ kinəcapan</l>
    .<l n="d">yāṅde təñuhnya rumase ṅ viṅitnya ri vilāpa maṅləṅərakən</l>
    .</lg>
    . <!-- 2 (a) Q murchā- (d) Q maṅləṅəṅakən -->
    .<lg n="3"><l n="a">vvantən kalusyan i kisapvaniṅ kaka huyaṅnya tibra tan aləh</l>
    1130<l n="b">bhrantāṅajap kalavanan raras ri rəcəpiṅ rimaṅ saturida</l>
    .<l n="c">līlā yadin layata riṅ pasir təhər aṅiṣṭya bhāṣaracana</l>
    .<l n="d">tañ jrih rinūdha ri panumbəriṅ ryyak arəṇah tayeṅ paṅinəpan</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="4"><l n="a">strī ratna dug siṅi rarasnya tekin asavaṅ səkar sumalaga</l>
    1135<l n="b">śokāṅaraṅ kapilaṅə̄ ri sor nikaṅ aśoka mār pinijətan</l>
    .<l n="c">lot vinvaṅiṅ kaka hamatya-matyani hatur priyambada marək</l>
    .<l n="d">tovin vruh aṅlipurakən ta kiṅkiṅ ika tan saheṅ nr̥pasuta</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="5"><l n="a">ndin ṅganya yan məkara dantaniṅ salaga viṣṭi rūmnya tan irəṅ</l>
    1140<l n="b">ardhāluñut ri tayaniṅ kapat marəkakən ririsnyan aməḍar</l>
    .<l n="c">nirdon səvə̄nya kadi tan sihiṅ pavana irṣya medi capala</l>
    .<l n="d">maṅgāṅañut jalada nisturān pinalariṅ hunaṅ katanəhan</l>
    .</lg>
    .<lg n="6"><l n="a">toh ndyāvaśāna nika tan vaneh viḍala rūmnya denya kapati</l>
